name: Georgia Ford
text: Today one of your men delivered 2 boxes to my house 87 Bryan Ct. Dora, AL.  I am in a wheel chair and it takes me a bit to answer the door.  It was pouring down rain and he banged on the door and left the boxes on the porch in the rain and ran back to his truck.  By the time I got to the door and got it opened he was driving off.  This was the worst possible thing he could have done.  I am not happy.

resp.text: I sincerely apologize for the inadequate service.  We, however, at The UPS Store, have nothing to do with drivers or deliveries.  We are a Franchise of UPS, and have Retail establishments only.  The best possible thing that you can do, is to call UPS Customer Service and explain your situation.  They will be more than happy to message the hub in Birmingham, where this driver comes from, and let them know of your circumstances, so that this won't happen again.  Although we actually had nothing to do with this delivery, here at The UPS Store, along with UPS, value your business and appreciate you bringing this to our attention.  We will pass it along to UPS so they can deal with it accordingly.  Their phone number is 1-800-742-5877.  It is a voice prompt system, so if you'll simply say, "Missed delivery" a few times, it will pass you along to a live operator.  Thank you again for your business and if we can help you in any way at The UPS Store in Jasper, we'll be more than happy to do so.  Jeff Graham, Owner

name: Anthony Kimbrell
text: They have definitely  been able to take care of any of the business or shipping needs I have faced...and have accomplished it flawlessly.

name: Paula thrasher
text: Staff is so so. It's cheaper at the post office and usually quicker but if you're shipping breakable items, let them pack it up for you. It will get there in one piece!

name: Poopshovel Thealmighty
text: Love 30+ minute wait times when you're the ONLY person in the store? Incompetence? An army of octogenarians who can't get out of their own way? This is the place for you! Every time I go here, which is only to ship something next day air out of desperation, I swear it's the LAST TIME. You'd be better off WALKING your package to its destination.

resp.text: We never have more than a 10 minute wait in our store. Complex print jobs do sometimes take longer, but there are always 2 or more employees and we pride ourselves on our quick and competent customer service. I'm sorry that you had a bad experience and we'd love to have the chance to make it right. I've owned this store for over 15 years now, and wouldn't be here without the strength of my staff, the ability to solve problems, and the great customers that come into my store time and time again.

name: john trice
text: My wife had a fairly complex printing job. It turned out a little off but the manager was able to unbind the project and make it work. Good work.

resp.text: Thanks for the business! We're glad we were able to help you and your wife, and look forward to serving you again in the future!

name: Linda Dutton
text: Great, can't say enough good things about the service, knowledgeable employees!  They get the job done quickly and right the first time. Thank u

resp.text: Thank you for putting your faith in us. We will always strive to provide the highest level of customer service possible!

name: Shelly Hardy
text: Great people very helpful and fast

name: Google ruined Youtube
text: Really sick of my packages being sent to my neighbor. Of course, this happens in Walker County! Even in broad daylight. Pure laziness and/or incompetence. Happened multiple times.

name: Marsha Lynn
text: Friendly staff and they sell supplies. Can mail any packages, letters and sell stamps, money orders too.  Printing, copying as well.

name: Nicholas Worden
text: Friendly, very clean, and always dependable!

name: Michellè Michelle Michellé
text: Great atmosphere and people

name: Madeline Perkins
text: Came here five minutes after they opened on a Monday morning and Jim could not have been more helpful! My stuff was all a mess and he helped me get labels on everything and send it off. And he was patient and so nice the whole time. 10/10 recommend! They’re the best.

name: Amy Robinson
text: Always very friendly and extremely professional!  Thanks

name: Josiah Roop
text: EXCELLENT service! Extra time was devoted to ensure that I was given the lowest cost shipping option possible. Employees were kind and personable. Always choose this UPS Store over the FedEx one block away.

name: Anne Donaldson
text: The staff here are friendly and helpful! And good at their jobs! I've never felt compelled to write a review for a store like this, but DEFINITELY give these people your business. 2 thumbs up.

name: Isaac
text: Very fast notary service! And respectful staff. Far better experience than the UPS store on 20th South.

name: GINGER GULLEDGE
text: We sent 3 very important plaques and worried about them arriving intact. We shouldn't have worried!!! Keight really took care of us! They arrived on time and in perfect condition! Great job!

name: Emily Canady
text: Very fast an an great customer service

name: WHITNEY JONES
text: I Hate UPS! They have lost or stolen multiple of my packages! I will never ever use there washed up services again.

name: Tully Corbett
text: Larry and his crew are the bomb! They turned a custom printing job for me in under 48 hours and saved the day. I strongly recommend them.  I wrote this review 2 years ago and they continued to deliver.

name: Elise Strong
text: Friendly staff treats you like family. Always helpful for me when I have art I need printed!

name: David Jennings
text: Always dependable,  I have depended on this store for over 8 years. They are always there for me and I give them a Five Star Rating, Thanks for everything John David Jennings

name: Christopher Lawson
text: We just recently shipped 14 packages from this location. They were nice enough to give us a cart to use to get all the packages into the store and took care of the rest for us. They shipped the same day.

name: Brian Whittington
text:
I got there at 9:00am (the posted opening time) Saturday to pickup a package, waited 30 min, but they never opened.

EDIT: Went back at 10:48am and they still weren't open

name: Sol Badguy
text: Closed. Under construction...

name: ethel smith
text: Love to go there

name: Matt Lathrop
text: They closed 20 minutes early and I couldn't pick up my package.

name: Kamal Elwa (epw)
text: Very friendly and helpful employees.  Super fast service as well.

name: Kayleigh Wilson
text: Exceptional customer service! Melissa A., who helped me, definitely went above and beyond, making things SO easy for me! The other ladies working to help other customers, were friendly and efficient as well. Thanks so much for your help to today, what a blessing!

name: BHvrd
text: Super fast, friendly and professional. Not sure what the other reviews are about, maybe it has changed or they got more help? Either way it was a very pleasant, professional and easy experience and I saw or had no issues whatsoever.

resp.text:
Thank you so much BHvrd! We are so happy to know we were able to take care of all your needs as well as make it a pleasant one! Can't wait to see you again!!

Thank you,
Management

name: Caleb Williams
text: Extremely friendly staff. They definitely go above and beyond to try to help me. No doubt the best UPS store in the area.

resp.text: Thank you Caleb for your kind review! Thank you for choosing us here at The Foley UPS Store. See you soon!

name: Kourosh arsani
text: Been there 2 times ,they serve the customers with outmost respect and  beautiful smiles . Awesome people .

name: Robert Wagner J Jr
text: This store should have lost its franchise years ago with its continued way of over chaging its customers for their basic services.  Their excuses are always directed towards their franchis being privately owned and therefore not having to comply with other stores in the area. User be warned.

name: Roger Paaymans
text: If I could post less than 1 star it would be suitable, they do not answer the phone , if they do they put it on indefinite hold. Provide the wrong information and do not follow up on issues with packages. I would not recommend this store.

resp.text:
Hello,

I do apologize for your issues. This store is currently short staffed and with longer wait lines in the store, it is sometimes difficult to answer the phones.
Management was able to ship your package back out for you to help resolve your issue.
If you feel that your issue was not resolved to your satisfaction, please feel free to contact us here at the store or email us.

Thank you,
Management

name: Michael Everett
text:
Excellent customer service and efficiency.
They are so fast and courteous.

resp.text: Thank you Michael. We are happy to help our customers in any way. Can't wait to see you again!

name: Lyn93
text: I go to this location almost weekly, and they have FABULOUS customer service!! Efficient, kind and extremely courteous. I have not a single complaint 👍

name: Gail GULF SHORES
text: Today 8-28 was so pleased with the service I received. Emailing the store was a great experience,  was answered  right away. The employees in the store were so attentive. Great experience!

resp.text:
Hello Gail,

Thank you for your kind review. We strive here at The UPS Store to provide each customer with personalized excellent customer service.

Sincerely,
Management

name: Ashley Urbanek
text: I absolutely love this store the staff here are super nice extremely helpful and are willing to do small things to make your day so much better. I was in a hurry and needed to have a form printed not only did the girl go above and beyond to make sure that the right ones were printed and in a timely manner she told me not to worry about the price of the copies and to just go because I was in such a hurry! So this also restored my faith in humanity! LOL thank you store number 4841 you made my day!

name: Matthew Hixenbaugh
text: I read quite a few reviews before going into the Foley location.  A lot of reviews I read were negative and kind of discerning.  I didn't want to judge based off other people's experience but I can tell you mine was just fine.  Chelsea knew exactly what she was doing and had me out of there in no time. 5 gold stars for U Chelsea

name: Michael Chang
text: Took an old coffee bean grinder to send to my sister in Virginia and they wanted $71 to pack it in a small box and ship it ground.

resp.text:
Dear valued customer,

We here at The Foley UPS Store strive to provide top-notch packing & shipping. Items such as appliances and fragile items require specific packaging to ensure that all packages arrive in both a timely and safe manner. We do apologize if you felt that our prices were too high or costly. Please feel free to contact us here at the store to resolve any issues you experienced during your visit.

Thank you,
Management

name: Mis Randi
text: Christa and Josh were awesome! They both greeted me when I came in (very friendly).I just needed to fax something in a timely manner and they handled that with speed and care; had a few laughs while I was there too! I've been there before, and never had any issues with anyone and I'll be back.

name: Marie P
text: Horrible customer experience by Lauren and Chelsey. Stay away from this store. They will over charge you on everything. They will not address your concerns. They will also not return phone calls or go out of their way for excellent customer service.

name: Russell Brantly
text: There are 3 local UPS Stores, Foley and Orange Beach have the same owners, Gulf Shores is different owners. Normally I use Gulf Shores, because I work in the area, I found them to be a little high, but nothing crazy, cost of business, no problem. Occasionally, on my day off, I've used the one in Foley because it's closer to my home. The one in Foley is twice as expensive in my experience. I asked them to download 1 sheet of paper and print it so I Could sign it. Then have them scan it into a pdf and email it to me. Foley price $14, Gulf Shores $6.50. You judge.

name: Benjamin Harms
text: None of the workers in here are wearing masks in the middle of a global pandemic.

name: Benjamin Harms
text: Not one single worker wearing a mask. Shameful af.

name: Meg Thompson
text: No one with masks. Nada.  None.  During a pandemic. On Jan 5 2021.  This is shameful behavior.

name: Compassionate Earthling
text: No one was wearing a mask. I gave this location two stars, because the associate I spoke with was friendly enough, but the lack of mask was enough to deter me from future visits.

name: Dillon Warren
text: The heavier set lady with blonde or dirty blonde hair, wears glasses.. She was insanely rude, rolling her eyes when I stated I don’t want to pay $17 for a small cardboard box (not including shipping). She was pretty rude to the other customers as I waited in line as well. She makes you feel like a burden being in her presence. I didn’t catch her name. Lord forbid I asked.

name: BeachLife
text: Customer service skills need to be taught. Holding up the counter not good business. Get it right the first time. So easy...smile, greet, how can I help you, explain service like the customer doesn't know, thank them...blah

name: Celeste Griffin
text: I visited this UPS store on 10/28/19 and the customer service was very poor.  The lady that took my package had walked past the counter and me to put something on a shelf. She stretched out her arms to take my package, she did not greet me or ask me if she could help me.  It wasn't until I asked a question that she spoke to me. I didn't get her name, but she has long brown hair.  I will never use this store again.

name: Charlene M.
text: The young lady who was running the store today was incredible! Madison I think. The line was to the door and she was all by herself. By the time i got to the counter she still greeted me with a smile and helped me get done shipping my package fast. I don't like doing reviews but i felt this girl needed recognition for how she handled a very busy store and how she treated customers. I witnessed a guy snatch a package out of her hands and she nearly went over the counter. I feel there needs to be more than one person there at a time to make sure the employees are safe. If she was alone i'm sure she would have been scared.

name: tricia bankston
text: Excellent service.

name: Braf Ong
text: I normally dont review stores, but it this case I have to!  I walked into the ups store and felt like I was a priority. There was several people in line and a older woman at the register automatically looked up and welcomed me to the store. I didnt have to wait very long, but she still apologized for the wait. She seemed so sincere! She was very talkative and friendly and acted as if she really enjoyed her job and people.  This kind of service should be everywhere. I definitely will be back . My receipt has Angela on it! Thanks again for the excellent customer service

name: lisa jon UN umes
text: I used ups to make copies. I drop off my copies to be single copy. The employee asked when I would like them. I said as soon as I was ready. The next day I sent someone to pick them up and she was told they won't be ready until sometime Monday, which was fine. But then I get a voicemail like two hours later on Thursday that they are ready. So I sent that same person to pick them up and pay $138.00. I then went over the copies about 400 was single copy, the rest was double copy which was over 1400. I had to separate the papers myself, which I was told by a co-worker they do that.I tired for a week to talk to someone about my order. When I finely did that same person who made my copy told me that I didn't say single and if I want to have them redo I will have to pay again. She pretty much blame me the customer because she didn't hear me. There was no form of any kind for me to fill out leave my instruction. Since she was the manager I ask to speak to the owner. She told me a time but when I called he was not their, I been trying to get ahold of him for a couple of days. I will not be using their service again, ever through they did give me a discount rate since these copies were for my class. I was always told the customer was always right from working in retail before.

name: Zilla 11 (Bheast)
text: Scheduled to have notary service.  Went to appointment and they said they didn't have appointments for notary even though sign on wall says notary services appointments available.

name: Yolanda M
text: Angela at this location stole my package which contained a cell phone. She sent me an email stating she picked it up and needed more info. When I called back she changed her name to Angel and said she doesn't remember the email. I started I could send it to her. She just played dumb after that saying I don't know what you mean. Don't trust them.  Angela stated it was a franchise location they don't have the same guidelines as a corporate location. She said after 48 hours they give the packages away but she doesn't remember if that is what happened to me. Just crazy!

name: Connie Hastings
text: I used to work there (PT as neeed) till the owners sold out. The new owners have put a manager in there that doesn't know his but hole from a hole in the ground. They have jacked the prices up. I have customers and Mailbox holders trying to personally contact me at my Fulltime job, trying to get in touch with me or my daughter. (Who also no longer works there) To complain and figure out why their mail is not being sent to them. I am having to tell them We no longer work there. Good luck with that! I am willing to bet they lose A ton of customers we worked hard to get back. Especially after Amy ran it into the ground. (That was 3 owners back)

name: Amanda Koehler
text: I have nothing but good things to say about this place. The manager is very helpful and if he doesnt know the answer to my hard questions he brings up the subject at the weekly meeting. I have dealt with many of the employees at this location and they all have been super nice and helpful.  I always get my faxes and notarizations done quickly.  Keep up the good work. This store is vital to our community.

name: Jennifer Beckworth
text: I didn't feel well, but the girl helped make everything easy and got me taken care of quickly.

name: Freddy Johnson
text: MULTIPLE times I have been waiting for the doors to open at 7:30 am and NOBODY was there. I've waited until 8:30 almost 9 when someone shows up to ask if I could get a notary only to be told they wont be there till 11am.. I came back at 11 and she says they wont be there until 1pm!! I will not be returning. This is a joke.

name: Jim Buckley
text: Had a large package to ship item sold on eBay..had problems at home trying to print shipping label..employee went well above normal assistance to help me resolve issues..will definitely continue to use this location. Fantastic customer service!

name: Mike Boan
text: Price is way too. Over charge compared to others.

name: Evie Byrd
text: I used to love this store but the last few months things have changed & I feel like I'm being ripped off! The prices are outrageous & the service sucks! WORST UPS STORE AROUND!!!!

name: Miranda Sanders
text: Kelly and her co-worker helped me out of a jam!  They're great!

name: shannon moore
text: Shipped a package on the 16th and supposed to be there on the 17th. Now the 22nd and they have rescheduled delivery everyday. Store is of no help. Wants me to call someone in Robertsdale and they were nothing but rude. Still have no idea where this 200 year old family heirloom is and UPS doesnt seem to care in the least.

name: Ashlee Arias
text: Extremely over priced. I was told “We can have the package there by Monday (2 day shipping) from Foley to Spanish fort for $50!!! I said I wanted the cheapest option THEN she says “The cheapest option is $15 and it will ALSO BE THERE BY MONDAY! Needless to say I won’t be going back.

name: red_key_randy
text: The lady upfront need better training before being left alone

name: Camren Wall
text: Tried charging almost $15 for the exact service that costs 2.71 at the post office. These people are thieves!!

name: William Lee
text: Very good that get your package on time

name: Holland Richardson
text: I waited an hour for the opening lady to show. She finally got there.. an hour a half late and then was rude the entire transaction. Her name was Chelsea i think

name: Angela Long (Courageous)
text: Chelsey is incredible!

name: Kristin Trostel
text: Very friendly

name: Chelsea Lacks
text:
Would NOT recommend. Spent $45 on 2 day shipping only to have the address where it was being sent entered in wrong. I spent Over an hour making phone calls to customer service and the store of the city that received  my package (because the Trussville store would not answer over a dozen times that I called) only
to have the current shipping status changed to returning to sender 2 days after it was supposed to be delivered. It was time sensitive and so now it’s contents are no good. Drove to the store and explained the whole order and was asked what I wanted. I told them the very least I wanted the shipping refunded, which I got. I’m still out all the time involved, the package contents, and now I have to do it all over again shipping through somewhere else. I was told they are busy and don’t have time to answer the phone. So if you want your package delivered, go somewhere else. Oh and to top it off, they entered my name and address in wrong as well so it won’t be making it back to me either.

name: Jay Jordan
text: My experience with this store was pretty great, in and out in a minute or two to drop some things off. The staff greeted me and was polite for the interaction.

name: Tonya Willis
text: The customer service in this store is absolute TRASH!!!!!  No help whatsoever!!!!

name: Jeff Martin
text: The customer service in this store is nonexistent. I dropped off a package at their facility and it has completely vanished. Records show that it never left the building. When I called to ask about it I was told that I would have to "get help from UPS"...even though this is UPS. Kept being told "you're not our customer" which is nonsensical. Just pick another location if you need actual help.

name: Mary Parsons
text: I rented 2 books from amazon for my classes. I took both books, printed off both return labels at the ups store and gave them to the boy at the counter. A month later i get a charge and an email from amazon saying my book was not in the package that was sent. When i called ups all he would was call amazon, call amazon, call amazon. Even tho i called amazon and they gave me a refund and cancelled the book from my list, im still not understand how my book was not received when it was the only item in the box. Did they send an empty box? Where is the book? To many unanswered questions.

name: J Green
text: They're fine if you just need to is drop off a package. Beyond that they are unreliable. Mistakes on their end are met with a shrug and a "What do you want me to do about it?" Do not bother asking who you can call to address the problem—they don't know.

name: Debbie Mccay
text: I had an extremely important documents I needed to send overnight from Moody Alabama to Vista California. I paid $44.14 to overnight this package. Yes I signed a paper but didn’t really read it. The clerk did not explain anything to me he acted like there was no problem and that it would get there the next day. What I didn’t know was he sent it through the US Postal Service and that there was no guarantee it would get there the next day. I sent it February 19 thinking it would get there February 20. I did not get there till Saturday the 22nd. And I’m tall too bad so sad by UPS. Those UPS stores are independent and can send an use any carrier service they want. I will never used UPS in Trussville Alabama

name: Eric Taylor
text: I rented a mailbox here today. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The cost was also much more reasonable than I thought it would be. The store, products and services are quite nice. I'm sure I'll be going back for more than just getting my mail.

name: Jamie Clayton
text: Have had to send back several orders and each time I go to the UPS store here in Trussville Alabama I am greeted with nothing but wonderful customer service and they are always eager to help me. My husband for his company and must utilize several things at the UPS Store offers he is very pleased let the customer service team receives

name: Frog Price
text: Smart, helpful employees. Notary service took only minutes. Good computer system for use to build needed flyer.

name: G C
text:
Extremely rude, unhelpful and unkind employees
I would walk my package to it’s destination before I went back in this store....

name: P Bark
text: Notary public service  $10.00, staff very friendly, respectful, and helpful good location plenty of parking

name: Christina Boggan
text: We've had a business mailbox there for 4 years. Very good service and friendly. Always willing to help.

name: Andy Bass
text: I paid for professional packaging of a framed picture. They placed my item in a box half filled with only peanuts, so my picture was destroyed. After 2 weeks they provided only a partial refund to make up for their mistake. DO NOT USE THESE GUYS!!!! They have no idea what they are doing!

name: Mick McMeme
text: Always reliable, always competent. Have had to ship expensive, fragile items and these guys have never disappointed.

name: Randy Coker
text: The best location to do business. Always  friendly.

name: James “XDMAN” Nicholas
text: Always friendly and give great service.

name: Evelyn Roebuck
text: Excellent service and great csr

name: Justin Maxwell
text: Quick and friendly service

name: Cindy Hafley
text: Michael’s customer service is atrocious. He is who did my transaction and he was so rude I was honestly stunned. He was literally sighing, rolling his eyes, got smart when I said I wanted to “mail” something (“You mean you want to SHIP it?”). You would have thought it was the end of the world when he had to verify my address and it turned out I needed to change it. So unnecessary. I was also shocked when I looked at his name tag and it said he has been there since 1999. From the other reviews I’ve read, I’m not the only person treated like this at this location, so fedex obviously doesn’t care how their employees treat their customers. Trent is great though, for the record.

name: Aries Gates
text:
I rate this experience as a one because I have never been discriminated against in a fedex store until today! I was shipping to packages off today, one to my mortgage company and another to At&t. When I got to the counter the representative told me that AT&T system was down but she would check to see if  it was back up and running. It was still down so she directed me to the UPS store about 1.2 miles away and I went to go get in the car to call ATT before going to UPS to see if this was a outage all over it just Fedex Kinkos. The ATT representative told me they didn’t have a issue so I go back in the store to see if their system was back up. A older lady that I helped in the store before leaving stopped me and said the Caucasian guy behind me earlier had a package he was shipping back to At&t as well. The representative told him that the system was down but she would hold it for him and ship it when the system came back up. I asked the representative when I walked back in the store was the system back up, she replied no it’s still down. I asked could she hold my package and ship it when it come back up, she replied they aren’t allowed to do this.

I replied but you just did it for the Caucasian man who was sending a package to At&t to. She looked shocked!  She replied she isn’t suppose to do that but my problem is you did do it & he was behind me. You sent me to UPS but you didn’t send him! Do you know how this makes me feel (small very small) because I’m Black I can go to UPS but because he is white you can hold it for him and ship it later. I have always used fedex and I’m very disappointed in how I was discriminated against today but you guys will be hearing from me soon. My name is Markita Gates and this took place between 12:30pm & 1:00pm, the guy went to the counter right after me at 12:41pm. This is unacceptable!

name: Rob “Deacon Yomouf” Allbanks
text: Today was a good day! Ask for Leslie, she works!

name: K’Shira Hinkle
text: The associate that I spoke with on the phone is in need of some type of customer interaction training. I was asking about speaking with someone that can talk to a driver about a delivery that is scheduled for today and he said there’s no way to get that done. After I suggested that they implemented a new policy for there to be a way to contact the drivers he then tells me that they don’t deal with the drivers because that location is print and ship only. I then asked why he didn’t inform me of that and give me the number or transfer me to someone that could contact the drivers and he began to get rude. I asked for his name several times and he wouldn’t tell me. Then he put me on hold for the customer service line. Get it together FedEx

name: John Higginbotham
text: I would not recommend this facility for your shipping needs. FedEx in Alabama is a joke. Multiple upon multiple damaged packages and the customer service here is absolutely terrible.

name: Deb Jacobs
text: No one is ever available to help. I'm handicapped.

name: Corey Turner
text:
Went into the store to get a passport photo, simple right?
Not to the employees who didn't want to act enthused to help with anything. First and last visit in one day!

name: Ingrid Schnader
text: I had such a good experience here. I needed to design and print 100 lost dog flyers. I laminated 10 of them. I was in and out within 20 minutes and didn’t have to spend too much money. And I found my dog!! The flyers were beautiful and clear. I will definitely return next time I need something printed!

name: Maya Madden
text: I had a really difficult situation getting my package through customs and needed someone to be as fired up as me about it. I called several international agents and none knew what was going on, I was so worried I was going to lose my merchandise. Amber was really the only one who rose up to the plate and got my situation handled. She went above and beyond calling international on my behalf and my package is safe and sound. THANK YOU AMBER!

name: Steve Dellinger
text:
Always stellar service.  Good people with great attitudes.
I drive across town to use this location, because they are fantastic.

name: Eva Teresa Virciglio Holmes
text: I always have a great experience here with the customer service. Very helpful , nice and knowledgeable.

name: Lessie Rodriguez
text: Great customer service! Michael was very pleasant and informative.  Location accessible. I wish the location was closer.

name: Adrienne Bowens
text: I normally visit this location and the service is awesome but today my experience was awful everyone had an attitude and 1guy even asked if I could have my kids wait outside which are 4 and 6

name: Tyler Volz
text: Go to a UPS store. The self service kiosks are awful

name: Nice Rich
text: Oh My Gosh, what a life saver. I mean, they had a stamp and an envelop and I made 4 overly priced copies, but could not scan them and they couldn't mail my letter for me and the workers didn't seem to want to be there but at least they had a stamp! Is there tax on stamps? I think they charged me tax on stamps?!? I should call the Postmaster. I needed to get the Paternity DNA results to my cousin cuz she was insistent it was my baby but I knew it was her brother's! Maynard struck agian

name: Joel Alakhras
text: Love FedEx specially a shout out to Mrs.Amber Assistance Manager! She makes sure that your treated like a valuable customer!!

name: Andrew Weaver
text: great employees; more helpful service than I expected.

name: jessie pratt
text: They were very professional & respectful nice & that what you go there for🆒💯!!!

name: Bryan Baez
text: I went to my local Ship Center to see if I can ship  a poster to CA. It took the "Store Manager" 7 minutes to finally tell me it would be $50 using there "Super Saver option"  to ship a poster from AL to CA! The so called "store manager" was yawning the whole time I was waiting for him to figure out the shipment details it was (10AM). I went to the post office and shipped for $7.

name: K Melissa Swearingen
text:
I called ahead and spoke with Ellis about passport photo information, and he was the person who assisted me in person, albeit all of the employees were very kind and helpful.

I will be back to this location!

name: Clayetta Montee
text:
UPDATE:  I went to this location yesterday just to look and see if this most unpleasant employee is there.  As happens with large corporations too often, she was PROMOTED to driver.  I couldn't believe a promotion instead of demotion was her reward for running customers off.  However, since she is no longer in the store, if they accept my perfectly good boxes, I will use this branch again.  if not, I will continue to ship through my employer.

PREVIOUS POST: This used to be my favorite shipper and favorite FED EX location.  I even have my own personal Fed Ex account.  However about a year ago Fed Ex must have brought in a new female day manager or supervisor and she behaves like a shrew.  I was believe her name was Helen.  She misquotes Fed Ex's shipping policy and refuses to use "banker's" boxes and other good boxes that are actually more sturdy than she sells at that outlet. She says it is FedEx's policy and I have since found out - it is not FedEx policy, but may be the individual store policy.  But she says it is FedEx policy.  However, she is most loud and belligerent and actually refuses to ship unless in boxes "like she sells" and pulls off the shelf "because Fed Ex will no longer accept those boxes".  Not true.  She won't accept the boxes.  She claims my boxes are not as sturdy (not true) and it is FED EX's policy not to accept those boxes.  Not true.  I've checked Fed Ex's shipping and packing policies and my boxes are very acceptable...and they are more sturdy than the boxes she is trying to force me to buy.  I will no longer ship there but ship through my work and have the charges deducted form my payroll.  Fed Ex is happy to pick up my boxes at my work without trying to make me buy boxes from Fed Ex.  My work place ships many boxes like my boxes (that's where I get my boxes) without any problem.  Someone needs to retrain or terminate the weekday supervisor or manager at this office.  I have read of many complaints about the personnel at FedEx-Kinko locations since Kinko and Fed Ex combined their locations.  I will not go back to this location with Helen there.  When I can't use my work place for shipping (as when the boxes too heavy for me to take in), I have driven 35 miles round trip to drop off my boxes elsewhere instead of dealing with this unpleasant person...what a shrew.

name: Karla Pesquera
text: I happy they have a good people working there, good customer service

name: Sherie Mcneal
text: 5 good service

name: Mario Sanchez
text: Very convenient hours, only downtown location.

name: Katrina Nakhjavan
text: Helpful and very nice employees.

name: Willie Parrish
text: It's just a place to ship a package. Very cool clean.

name: iamweida
text: They are one of a few exceptions to show that FedEx can be slower than USPS. Always choose the local UPS if possible.

name: Louvenia Bell
text: Great experience a lot of help from representative

name: Mike Hump
text: All ways great service.

name: Sh Mills
text: There is only one person working. ..many waiting.  Not fair to the employee or the customers waiting. Get him some help FedEx!

name: Tyler Giddens
text: I was supposed to receive a package on the 24th of November and they changed the arrival date 4 times, as I track my package I’ve noticed that it’s been on a truck for delivery the past 5 days and no one can tell me where my package is or why it’s taking so long to come in. TERRIBLE experience.

name: APOSTLE DARLEEN PEOPLES
text: IT WAS GREAT

name: Lessie Rodriguez
text: Salesperson was awesome!

name: Brian McCarty
text: Rude employees

name: Doug Fraley
text: The service ever

name: Apostle Darleen Peoples
text: GREAT!!!

name: Megan Warren
text: We love working with City Paper Company. Outstanding customer service. Using them for our retail packaging and promotional needs has been so nice. Their pricing and quality is always top-notch. I love that I can pick up the phone and speak with my rep, Drew, anytime. He makes things so easy for me!

name: Mike Doyle
text: As a Marketing Director I've been on the receiving end of a million cold calls. The best one I ever got was from Rachael at City Paper. A dropped-off box of donuts and a business card led to a conversation, which led to another, which eventually led to a significant and mutually beneficial business relationship. City Paper has provided a turnkey solution to so many challenges we were facing as a business. They're not only easy to do business with, they're extremely customer-oriented, super helpful and a lot of fun to boot. I wish all our vendors were like City Paper.

name: Carly Stoltz
text: I have been ordering items from City Paper Company for about 2-3 years and I have never been disappointed. Drew in sales is amazing and is always willing to help me pick the right items my company needs, even when we had a very tight deadline! We recently had a difficult order and they were able to get items for us to chose from, get them proofed, ordered, printed, and delivered to us all within a very tight timeframe. They do amazing work and everyone I've interacted with at the company has been pleasant to deal with. Don't waste your time with the big, cheap companies you see advertisements for! City Paper is where the great business & good prices are!

name: Ronnie O'Brien Rice, PhD, Attorney
text: Our law firm has been working with City Paper for a while now and the services is great. The account executive Nadav Raviv is awesome. The timeliness of receiving products and the free flow of ideas makes this company great to work with in regards to taking your promotional department to the next level!

name: Courtney Smith
text: City Paper Company does a great job at finding the right products for you and their customer service is the best around! You truly feel like part of the family when working with them. I highly recommend using City Paper Company for any of your promotional and marketing needs!

name: Jessica Norris
text: American Family Care has been working with City Paper since last summer and they are hands down the best in customer service! They are more than just a vendor...they are truly an extension of our marketing department. Special thanks to Nadav and Stephanie for making my job a whole lot easier!

name: Holly Laughridge
text: We have used City Paper for years for our custom shopping bags, garment bags, and custom tissue paper. The experience has always been so positive that we now order promotional items, retail products, and even gift wrap and bags. Drew and Brad have always been upfront about pricing and lead times based on quantity and their vendors. On a reorder for our shopping bags, they came back and presented another option- a less expensive bag, but it would take longer to ship. They left the decision up to me- I so appreciate that level of customer service! I always appreciate Drew's input on items that he thinks are beneficial to our business. He has taken the time to get to know our clientele and makes solid recommendations. They also send the best Christmas packages of all our vendors 😊

name: Kim Williams
text: I ordered labels for my company.  It was so nice to have a real person to talk to when designing my labels and ordering.  My experience with City Paper was top shelf.  Thank you for quality and quick delivery. Blue Ridge Artisan Chocolates

name: Savannah Rawlston
text: Mayer's true partnership with City Paper has become essential to our operations. They offer digitally connected solutions that we couldn't find elsewhere!

name: Molly Green
text: It is wonderful to work with City Paper. We have had nothing but great experiences working with them over the past 4 years. Our sales rep Drew, goes above and beyond for us.

name: Angela Bush
text: City Paper does an excellent job! Kara Richards is a fabulous addition to their team.

name: raina kant
text: Worst customer service!! Ordered garment bags and the last 50 are ripped going down the side. Nothing they can do. REALLYY!!!!  I have sent more than 15 new companies, that I have mentored into using them. NO MORE!!!!!

name: Rachel Gipson
text: worst customer service EVER!!!!

name: Freeman Presson
text: I had a booklet printed and bound here. The work was perfect, and I got a great price. Service was superbly fast and friendly.

name: Jamie McLynn
text: Always the most helpful staff!! Really appreciate the customer service here.

name: Rebecca Stivender
text: They are the best!!  I walked in frantically trying to get an urgent package to family out of town, and Anna was so kind and helpful.  She truly went above and beyond!

name: Madison K.
text: Went into this location not knowing exactly how I wanted my art to be printed, but Anna took the time to talk it through and gave us multiple options. She definitely went the extra mile, and my print turned out even better than what I imagined! Thank you, Anna!!!!

name: Sam Sharples
text: By far the best shipping location in Birmingham. I gladly drive by multiple other UPS and Fedex locations and suffer parking in Five Points to use this location. They don’t nickel and dime customers, but earn business through respect and friendliness.

name: Aakruti Sharma
text: Awesome store with super-friendly staff!

name: CeeDeeAre 4Real
text: Five Stars - Good experience at this UPS store.  Erika, Bradley and Carlos were of tremendous help!  I will go there now on a regular basis.  Thanks so much.

name: Ritika Ramchandani
text: Went it needing to check on a package That I paid for overnight shipping for 3-5 days ago. They basically told me they couldn’t do anything about and that I was informed when dropped the package off that they wouldn’t be able to do anything. I was not informed of that, yet the *manager* persists that “all his people are well trained so he knows that I was informed.” I LAUGHT at that response. Trust your customer if they told you that no one told them what you’re telling them. Do not insult their integrity by CLAIMING that “all your employees are well trained and would’ve told you.” CLEARLY THEY WERE NOT, TRY AGAIN.

resp.text:
Ritika, we hear you and we understand your frustration. As we have mentioned already, we are a third party vendor of UPS services, not UPS themselves. UPS currently does not guarantee delivery dates for any packages due to Covid19. Additionally, once UPS has picked up your package from our retail location, we no longer have possession of it, and therefore cannot just provide it back to you.

We would love it if you direct your concerns to the UPS customer service department at 1-800-742-5877.

name: c p
text: I will never go here, or any other ups store. You pay $200 for the day they tell you, but your package arrives a week later, and all they say is WELL!!!!. Well...... You don't have to worry about my business or anyone I know using you for any shipping needs.

resp.text:
We are so sorry you had an unfortunate experience at The UPS Store in Southside.  We understand your frustration with the cost of shipping and the delivery delay, but the holidays are a tough time for all carriers, not just UPS.  Guarantee dates are suspended due to volume.  Additionally, we at The UPS Store have no control over the pricing or delivery of packages. We are small business owners - franchisees who do not set pricing or guarantees.

As for being told, "Oh, well..." this is a customer service issue that we will look into.  We appreciate you bringing it to our attention and hope you will give us another opportunity to show you the World Class Customer Service we strive for.

name: Rhiannon Deierhoi Reed
text: Have had great success with this location the past two years making calendars for family. Very courteous employees, efficient service, and high quality products. I will continue to use this spot for future printing needs!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words! We are always glad to hear that we've done our job right - "courteous employees, efficient service, and high quality products" describes our mission perfectly!

name: Tina Cao
text: The BEST ever!!! Staffs are so friendly and professional, and they always give me the best experience. Every time I go there they always manage to get me out of there in less than 5 minutes which is IMPRESSIVE!!!

resp.text:
Tina,

We appreciate your review, and we're so glad you enjoyed your experience with us. Come back and see us soon!

name: S King
text: Best place around! All the employees are so nice and eager to help you. Ask for Jaelynn, he’s the best! Spent almost an hour with me trying to work with an issue I had. So awesome

resp.text:
S King,

We're so glad to hear you had a good experience, and we always appreciate a shout-out for an individual staff member. We hope to see you again soon!

name: Jason “Squig” McCrory
text: A very professional and knowledgeable staff. The print shop is amazing. As a photographer I work hard capturing images for my clients and The UPS Store In five points always takes care of my needs, so I can serve my clients faster.

resp.text:
Jason,

We appreciate your continued business, and I look forward to seeing you soon!

name: Barbara Schwartz
text:
Better Than the Rest!
Attentive, knowledgeable, engaging staff. Neat, well equipped store. Free parking in back. Took pack & ship order in on Wednesday two weeks before Christmas. Decided to use UPS ground. Packages were delivered several states away on Friday.

resp.text: Barbara, we're so glad to hear you enjoyed your experience with us and received the services you needed! We appreciate you taking the time to leave a detailed review, and we look forward to serving you in the future!

name: Chandra Brown
text: UPS sucks I had to drive around town to find all of their drop boxes that are in weird buildings and convenience stores, and the drop boxes are so small u really can't put in any normal to medium packages. Which isn't convenient. Why would a packing and shipping company have such small drop boxes to begin with. The package wouldn't fit in the box. The post office drop box is much larger. Wow ..... UPS, thanks for nothing.  And all of your locations close early...the latest is open to 7pm. The Main post office is open later than that and less expensive. Why not have at least one location in the City of Birmingham or surrounding areas that are open at least til midnight. UPS is in my opinion is a very inconvenient place to do business with. Two thumbs down

resp.text:
Chandra,

While we here at The UPS Store Southside understand your complaint, you are unfortunately responding to the wrong company.

The UPS Store Southside is a locally owned and operated franchise of The UPS Store, a chain of combination Print Shop and Pack-and-Ship vendor. We are ten folks from Birmingham who do graphic design and digital and wide-format printing and offer UPS, USPS, and DHL services as a third-party vendor.

Your complaint against the United Parcel Service, Inc is an understandable one, but rating our location 1* won't accomplish any change. We aren't the logistics company based out of Atlanta, and this location isn't owned by them either. Your review is understandably but incorrectly levied at us, and that hurts our business, despite that fact that we don't operate UPS trucks, nor do we maintain UPS drop boxes.

We know the name "The UPS Store" makes us sound like a corporate entity, but we're not, or else we couldn't say that the name "The UPS Store" was a stupid choice for loosely-affiliated franchises.

We would kindly ask that you remove your rating if you are not one of our customers, or that you correct your rating to reflect our service correctly if you have commissioned work from us before. Again, that would really help our locally owned small business thrive. We can also put you in touch with people at UPS who can actually help get your complaint to the right people. Please feel free to come in and see us, or email us at Store4088@TheUPSStore.com. We'd genuinely love to help you voice your complaint, as we frequently do to UPS ourselves.

Again, we appreciate your frustration, and we thank you in advance for correcting the record.

Jeff Flannery, Owner
Myra Fabian, Operations
Nick Salyers, Printing

name: Debbie Lagarde
text: I've visited this store numerous times since moving to town. It's become one of my favorite places to do business. The services I've employed include parcel shipment, printing, and notary. Usually I have questions about the task at hand, and the associates have been friendly, knowledgeable, and fun. They also don't mind giving newcomers to the area a head's up about local businesses. Impressed!

resp.text: Debbie, we're so glad to hear you've had a great experience! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Isaac
text:
Notary service is very unprofessional. Kept telling me to wait “couple of minutes” and ended up wasting  30 minutes of my time. My time is more valuable than the cost of your service.

Replying to the owner's response:
I was not informed that it would be up to half an hour. I was told to wait "Few minutes" and even if English isn't my first language, I understood that few ,even though isn't an exact term, it won't be a 20-30 minutes wait. If I didn't say something, I would've ended up waiting for more than 30 minutes. When I called the store the day before, i was told that Notary services are offered when you walk in.  the UPS store on 20th St North truly provides a walk in notary service.

I paid for the service at the cashier in advance as I wanted to save time and the "offer" you are talking about is how one of your employees brought back the money and receipt and handed it to me and told me to go to another store. So you basically kicked me out. That was also very disrespectful.

I never requested a special treatment because of my station or title. So don't use that. I am only informing people on here that the Notary Service is unprofessional.

resp.text:
Isaac,

As we informed you when you arrived, the only notary in-store when you arrived also serves as our General Manager, our Chief Graphic Designer, and our primary Printer. You were informed that it could be several minutes, up to half an hour, and that there were Notaries Public at other stores, which we offered to direct you to. You declined that offer and left after 20 minutes. We apologize that you are dissatisfied with the timeliness in which you were served, however, your time is not more valuable than that of the customers who arrived and submitted orders before you. We are committed to serving all of our customers equally, regardless of station or title.

name: Angie Boston
text: The young lady at the counter greeted me as soon as I walked through the door.  I was returning DirecTV equipment and was somewhat puzzled by the company's instructions which weren't too thorough.  However, she educated me really well on the  items they didn't want returned to them.  She checked that I had not left batteries.in the remote which I had intended to check before leaving home but forgot to do.  She was very friendly, courteous, and  knowledgeable.

resp.text: Thank you Angie, we appreciate your business and look forward to serving you in the future!

name: Ashley Kuntz
text: This is my favorite UPS store in Birmingham. I’d rather wait and go to this store on my way into work than go to the store down the street from my house. The staff at the Southside location are so incredibly helpful. Even when I don’t have everything perfectly prepared, they quickly take care of the package and get me checked out. I can’t believe I actually care enough about a UPS store to write a review, but this one is worth the time. Thanks, Folks. You rock!

resp.text:
Thanks Ashley! We are so thankful for your review. We hope to see you again soon!
-Management

name: Madeline Smith
text: I was in Birmingham from Boston, visiting a critically ill friend at UAB.  In the middle of that stress, urgent business came up.  Thankfully a nurse said 'go to the UPS Store up the street.'  Within minutes I was in the good hands of Bradley and the UPS team.  Printed out the documents, signed, notarized, faxed and then shipped overnight.  All that is part of their business model - however, it was the caring, the calming, the empathy  for my situation that made this an exceptional five star experience.   Grateful.

resp.text: Madeline, I'm so glad to hear you had an exceptional experience at our store, and we keep you and your friend in our hearts during their recovery. We hope you can come back and see us under better circumstances in the future!

name: Lauren Weekley
text:
Best place to go for any design or print needs, hands down!! Nick can work miracles. If you need something done and they for some reason can't do it in house, he'll help you figure out the best way to get it done. Nick has come in early, stayed late, delivered print to me personally when I couldn't pick it up. The entire staff at this store is amazing and helpful. 10/10, 5 stars, A+

Oh and they pack and ship things too

name: Michael Todd
text: Stopped in to drop off a package, very polite and professional staff, will definitely use them again.

resp.text:
Michael,

We're glad you had a good experience, come back and see us!

name: johnnie shaneyfelt
text: Update your store hours on Google so people don’t drive over in the rain during a pandemic to drop off packages. Says your open until 7 but the door says 6

resp.text:
Johnnie,

We appreciate your feedback and we apologize for the miscommunication. Google, without our knowledge, reverted our online hours listing to the pre-Covid hours, In accordance with Gov Ivey's Safer-at-Home ordinance, we will maintain our current limited hours until further notice. Please know you can always check our website and social media accounts for more current updates.

We have informed our tech team, who is working on a fix for the Google listing. Again, we apologize for any inconvenience, and we look forward to serving you in the future.

name: Mel Christian
text: I have issues with the online ordering system but that is not the fault of the local Birmingham, AL  Southside employees. I live in Tuscaloosa and needed six 11 x 17 signs printed in about a five hour window so I could frame them for a Birmingham theatre company. When I called to see if I could get them earlier than the 6pm quote, the woman helping me (I wish I had asked her name but this was the afternoon of  9/13/19 if that helps) said she would change some things around and get them for me by 3pm. I cannot tell you how much time and anxiety that saved me! Also while I as there I noted the other gentleman working  with her jumped up the minute a customer came in and was very professional and cordial.  In a world where customer service has gone down the toilet that really means something! I've also a few years ago popped by to get a notary signature and this location was completely helpful. Only complaint is the parking but...big city...whatcha gonna do? Again, thank you for helping me! It meant so much!

resp.text:
Mel,

We really appreciate you taking the time to share your experience, and I'm glad we got you taken care of! We are working to improve the parking, look for some major improvements in that area over the next year or so!

Come back and see us anytime, we'll save you a spot!

name: Jo hiNes
text: My printer wasn't working before I had to hwad to class... I emailed them while I was on the way and had my papwrs printed quickly. I was in and out in 5 minutes. I also bought a sympathy card and mailed off a package. They we're also VERY nice and courteous! Will definitely be back!!!

resp.text:
Thank you so much for your kind review! We work really hard at providing world class customer service to everyone no matter how big or small the job is; We look forward to seeing you again.
Thanks
-Management

name: Brandon Moore
text: I visited this store yesterday to drop off a package. I needed the box taped and I also need the label cut and taped to the box. I went in expecting them to sell me a roll of tape and scissors like the post office would make you do. I was surprised when I walked in to a very friendly staff that took my package and said well have this taped and ready to go today. I was out the door in less than 30 seconds! I highly recommend this ups store for all your shipping needs.

name: Reginald Croom
text: I have had the pleasure of working with the UPS Store team for many years. They are very attentive and detail oriented. A little patience is required considering the nature of this business. Great service, Great team!

resp.text: Reggie, we're so glad that you've had a good experience with us, and we're grateful for your continued patronage. We hope to see you soon!

name: Will Webb
text: Great customer service. Thanks especially to Nick for all the help shipping a package with dry ice. This (independently-operated) store really seems to go the extra mile for customers with unusual needs.

name: Gregory Kohlberg
text: Great customer service and I always can count on the deliveries scheduled

resp.text:
Gregory,

We're glad you have great experiences with us, and we're grateful for great customers like you!

name: Heather Dark
text: Unfortunately every time I go in this store (typically Saturday), the same employee is there with a snide remark, inappropriate statement, or just general rudeness that makes this place pretty unplesant for me. But, they’ve never lost a package, and have decent supplies so I’d say that part of the store is great.

resp.text: Heather, we, unfortunately, don't have enough information from what you've given to know what incidents you're referring to. If you would, please email us at store4088@theupsstore.com and answer a few questions for us so we can try to figure out what happened. Thanks.

name: Kristie Rankin
text: This location has always been a positive experience for me. Nick is very professional and almost reads my mind at times it seems.

resp.text: Kristie, we're so glad to hear about your great experience with us! We look forward to serving you again soon!

name: KDE5FAN
text:
Where to begin with this horror show, 1 star is much to high a rating.  The person I was dealing with was so horrible and incompetent that after 5-6 phone calls over 3 days(and zero of 4 emails responded to, emails with all the pertinent information for items to be picked up, packed and shipped) I asked to speak to a manager, well Bradley WAS the manager.  Great.  I asked if he had a supervisor or the owner and he dismissively told me HE was in charge - this is where the attitude ramped up, before it was somewhat subtle.

He would not respond to any email asking for quotes or telling me when they would pick up the items (the pickup service they offer).  It was like he didn't want to have record of the quotes or times in email.  He would respond to direct questions in email with "would you please just call me, how hard is that" - as if my schedule revolved around him.

After 3 weeks of trying to get them to pick up the auction lot, I made arrangements with another UPS store that would pick up the same day.  I called to cancel at the previous store, told Kody (who told Bradley while I was on the phone) and someone else as well and I also emailed the cancellation.  3-4 hours later they used the paperwork from the first email to pick up the items and I was informed by the other UPS store that the items were already picked up (the seller wasn't supposed to release it to them either but that isn't as much their fault)

When they packed up the items they used a huge box, about 3x larger than what was actually necessary basically tripling the cost of everything. It was very expensive now.  I knew this wasn't right so I emailed asking for the weight and dimensions of the box he used, and I got a reply of the dimensions and a "just call us" response.  This was after I had called 4-5 times that day and they were always too busy to talk.  Now he wanted me to call immediately (6 hours after the my first call) and when I didn't he proceeded to call 6 times in 30 minutes while I was  on the other line (call waiting beeping 40-50 times for each call, he just let it ring harassing me - I couldn't end my call it was important and why I called 6 hours prior and used email).

This harassment continued 3 more times with about 2-3 calls each time until their closing time (total of about 13-15 calls, ringing non-stop b/c no voicemail turned on).

My calls the next two days were hung up on, I never knew who answered the phone, but 5 calls were immediately hung up on when they were switched to an employee.

I called the other UPS store I had scheduled and told them what was going on and was going to have them pick up the items to ship.  I was informed of who to ask for at the other store and that they would be helpful.  I called back and got someone I hadn't worked with - Mikee.

This was a delight. From the very beginning the attitude was like night and day.  Bradley has no business working with customers or in customer service.  Mikee was helpful, promptly returning emails with complete answers and readable sentences, complete quotes, etc.  Included in the emails were the photos of how Bradley wrapped the items and it looked like a 4yr old had done it.

There were a couple fragile items, noted 3-4 times in previous emails (maybe Bradley can't read, IDK) that were to be wrapped in bubble wrap b/c they were glass.  These were the only things not in bubble wrap.  The large bulky durable plastic items were layered in bubble wrap and I told him they didn't need ANY.  So, Mikee took everything out of Bradley's packaging and re-packaged the items and did an EXCELLENT job.  I would rate that  part 5 stars,  but after 3+ weeks with Bradley, 1 star is too much.

The final shipping was less than 1/2 what Bradley quoted (and it wasn't $5 vs $10, it was MUCH higher).  The items arrived and everything looks to be in  order.

I just can't understand how this business can make Bradley a manager and deal with customers. I had another problem with  them 1 year ago with bad packaging on a piece of glassware, it looked like a 4yr old wrapped it too.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review. We truly do appreciate your feedback on where we can improve - and clearly, there is much room for improvement with the way we handled your shipment. We apologize that we fell short of the "World Class Customer Service" you were entitled to. We have addressed the situation with the manager and are taking steps to ensure it doesn't happen again. We acknowledge the 1-star rating we received from you and would appreciate the opportunity to prove to you that we are a 5-star store.

name: Oakside8
text: Great service. Friendly employees.

resp.text:
Oakside,

Great review, friendly customer. Come back and see us anytime and let us bump that 'great' up to an 'excellent'!

name: William Somerall
text: Courteous, attentive, and helpful. Highly recommended.

resp.text:
William,

We can't thank you enough for taking the time to leave us a review. We hope to see you again soon!

name: Larabeth Guthrie
text: This location has helped make sure I have professional items at a competitive rate regularly.  They are diligent about making sure everything is correct.

name: Jake Linder
text: Awful customer service. Three employees and not one said hello or I’ll be right with you. When I was finally waited on, the employee left me to help another customer and ignored me. UPS isn’t a charity and should expect professionalism from those they hire to represent them.

resp.text:
Jake,

First I want to thank you personally for taking the time to leave a review. We can't improve if we aren't held accountable, and I truly appreciate you taking the time.

Our SOP includes both an immediate greeting, as well as point-to-point customer assistance. Those procedures clearly were not followed, and for that we apologize. This is out of alignment with how we do business, and we are actively working to rectify those issues.

We know you have a choice in who you spend your money with, and we are working diligently to be better because you, the customer, deserve it. We look forward to doing better for you in the future.

name: Susan Henderson
text:
The UPS Store in Warrington, (Pensacola), Florida is equipped with the most courteous and knowledgeable staff who go above and beyond to help their customers.  It's a wonderful experience and I always get great service, walking out feeling good to have been helped by such nice people.  I have been to other UPS stores and haven't had the same experience.
Tom Kuklish is the owner/manager of this store and he is outstanding, always making sure his customers are taken care of, and if there are any problems, he's ready to solve them promptly and professionally.
S. Henderson

name: Champion Deivanayagam
text: Very professional service and the staff are always willing to help

resp.text: Champion, we're so glad to hear you enjoyed your experience at our store, and we look forward to working with you again in the future. Come back and see us!

name: S Garg
text: There is one of your employees at 20th Street South Birmingham store who is very rude. I have been to the store multiple times and he always behaves in a very condescending way. He has done it every time I go to the store, even if he is not assisting me. I think he is the store manager, Don't remember his name. He is tall white male, 6Ft something tall. I am writing this message as today he accused me of taking the store pen without checking if the store property was in place or not. I was carrying my own pen and I don't give a damn about a $1 pen but to be called out when it clearly wasn't UPS property without checking was really really rude. Please take necessary action, Thank you

name: Adrian Darren
text:
A few days ago I came in to have some designs and prints made up quickly.  I gave the instructions to the main graphics person and he didn't follow them.  I was upset with the situation and then he had the audacity to argue my instructions with me.  It wasted my time and I couldn't believe that was his idea of customer service.

I will be taking my business to the store in Homewood from now on.

resp.text: Unfortunately, as we expressed to you that day, The person you spoke with first (our night manager) and the person you spoke with second (our Print Manager) are two different people. As you'll recall, our Print Manager attempted to express this to you that day, as he wasn't in the store at that time you claimed to have spoken with him. Additionally, the reason why your instructions weren't followed was because when asked multiple times about your instructions, your answer was "I don't care." In the future, speaking to the correct people and making specific requests will eliminate the guesswork.

Thank You Lisa! We appreciate your kind response and we look forward to doing future business with you.

text: THE Worst UPS store.   Staff does not return calls and reply to emails.  They make promises that they don't support.

resp.text:
Dee,

Firstly, thank you for taking the time. I know nobody enjoys having a negative experience, regardless of the 'why', but it would help me immensely to know more about your specific instance. If you'd be so kind, please email us directly at store4088@theupsstore.com and let us know more about what happened. We take situations like this very seriously, but we often don't even know something has happened off-book until we see reviews like this.

I'm sorry you had a bad experience, and I'd like to do what I can to fix that for the future, and see if there's anything we can do to rectify your specific issue as well. Again, we sincerely thank you for taking the time to hold us accountable, it's the only way we can improve.

resp.text: We're sorry about the mix-up. As our employees expressed to you in-store, The UPS Store locations are not owned or operated by the United Parcel Service. As such, we are unable to accept unlabeled​ packages that are intended for UPS pickup, as that is a service which that company offers. We again apologize for any distress this caused you, and we'd be more than happy to help you contact the correct people in regards to your complaint against UPS.

name: Bo Time
text: Not a real UPS store, you cannot use accounts to ship from here. Store is not marked as an affiliate  but is. Staff Is discourteous.

resp.text:
Mr. Time,

This incident seems to arise from a fundamental misunderstanding about how the UPS Corporate umbrella works. Every single The UPS Store location is an individual franchise operating under The UPS Store, Inc. brand, a brand that is a wholly owned subsidiary of the United Parcel Service. We are not 'affiliates,' we are a child company that is both wholly owned and legally distinct from UPS, Inc. As such, we are required to follow UPS corporate policy as well as The UPS Store Corporate policy. This is not unique to ours or any other The UPS Store location.

UPS requires all UPS Customer Centers and The UPS Store locations to maintain their own 'Third Party Account' (also known as a UPS Shipping Account) and does not allow for any entity with a Shipping Account to ship using another entity's account number.

We, as The UPS Store Southside, would love to be able to accept these account numbers for payment, but we are explicitly forbidden from doing so. We do, however, apologize for the inconvenience this caused you. As you'll recall, when you came in on Friday, November 3rd at around 2pm, our associate did attempt to explain this to you. While we understand better than most just how confusing and frustrating some UPS regulations and policies can be, especially from the outside-looking-in, we feel that describing our staff as discourteous is, at the very least, misleading.

We hope this adequately resolves any lingering confusion, and if that's not the case, we invite you to reach out to us for further clarification.

Thanks!
~Management

resp.text:
Hi Daphne, we apologize that your service wasn't 100% satisfactory. If you wouldn't mind emailing the store (Store4088@TheUpsStore.com) with a detailed account of what you experienced, we'll be happy to sort out the issue!

Thank you! -Management

resp.text: We're sorry that you had to wait for our notary, who at the time was battling an illness that required frequent restroom visits. We understand waiting on medical issues can be frustrating, but unfortunately, that was simply the only option available, as the Notary Public position is not available to all staff, and as such, they were the only one on duty that day. However, please note that the Notary Public did, in fact, inform you of the issue when you were seated, and as such you were not left unattended. You were simply served in as timely of a manner as possible, given the circumstances.

text: I'm sitting in my manufactured home and no one knocks or blows, I would have heard it. My insurance man comes about fifteen minutes afterwards and knocks. I heard him!! Why is that? It's because he didn't knock. He left a tag on my screen door. Not on the inside door. The screen door was unlocked because I was expecting this wheel for my Harley Davidson!!! Get out and knock!! I work for the postal system, if you blow and you don't see an animal, you get out and make sure you knock!! He never attempted to deliver, he just put the door tag on the outside of the screen door and left!! That's not good business!! Then he goes back to Mobile!! I never try to give bad reviews because I work for the postal system but DO YOUR JOB!!!!! Especially, if I'm sitting and waiting. Just because you pull up in the yard and no one knows you're out there does NOT constitute you doing your job!! KNOCK AND SOMEONE WILL HEAR YOU!! Thank you!!

text: My son bought a steering wheel cover from Amazon that was too small for his steering wheel.  It had come in a plastic UPS envelope.   When he took it and the return label to this UPS store, the clerk, Melissa, without even checking, told him it would not fit in the plastic envelope that he would have to buy a box.  SHE CHARGED HIM OVER $13.00 for the box to mail the $17.00 steering wheel cover.  He questioned the price but she insisted it was correct.  He later pulled the receipt from his wallet and discovered she charged him for the box and 2 separate packing charges.  He went back a few days later and they refused to refund anything to him.  Melissa purposely upsold him on this box and packing charges.  We will never use this store again.

text: Website says call to verify notary services. I've called twice and no answer. It rings to a message that says "enter your remote access code." Also, needing to be verified during the time of the pandemic, is how they are handling services for the elderly at-risk population! You can't just be bandying these people about to drop in on places in find out the things you should be able to find out over the phone. I read some reviews on here that said they were thumbs down on customer service but they had improved. If you can't answer your phone, that is not a good sign!

text: The gentleman that helped me today was total awesome.. He helped from  explaining  shipping to random questions.  He carefully packed my framed picture in a custom box and provided better ideas for the box. I would go back to work with him again.  Thanks again for the help..
