text: This place was terrible when we went here a year ago. I went in again recently out of desperation. The line was huge but moved quickly, the lady at the counter was friendly and knowledgeable. I'm so glad it's not the two men that were in here before. I'm glad I can use this UPS store now.

name: Michael Shavers
text: I have to commend and applaud the complete turn around I've noticed from this UPS store location. Being under new management, the staff has made my experiences with this store nothing but pleasant. The level of professionalism and knowledge they now posess really make you, the customer, feel as if you are the only customer.  Kudos to the overhaul. I definitely will continue to do all my shipping with them from now on.

name: Judith Rudel
text:
I needed a package sent off from Amazon. But for this particular package they sent me the label to print. I don’t have a printer so I figured I’d pay a couple of cents to pay for the label to print at this UPS. The employee said it would $7.10 to print my label. I said really.. $7 dollars for a price of paper. So I went across the street to Office Depot to print my label it was a whopping .17 cents. Came back to UPS and now he wanted to charge me to tape my box and the label to it. He said I could buy tape from him and do it myself.  And if I would have paid them to print my label he would have done it complimentary.
SAFE to say I will be using I different location. I have never been to UPS that has treated me this poorly. They are always more than happy to spare a few feet of tape to wrap up my packages. Not to mention Amazon packages. That company brings them so much money it’s unreal. Yet they can’t simply tape a box complimentary.

name: Ashley Coleman
text: I was reluctant to go to this store at first because of all the bad reviews but when I got there, I was very happy with my decision. Every staff member that was there was very pleasant and professional. They all were very knowledgeable and friendly. I asked about the bad reviews and they told me that they are now under new management. I would definitely recommend this store and I will being doing business with them again.

name: Brandie Mclean
text: I’m eight months pregnant I’ve been to this location three times to return the same Amazon package and three times they’ve given me a different reason why they can’t return it. First it was the label even though I have had no problem in the past year and a half of returning Amazon packages. Then it was the tape. They tape the box for the guy behind me but won’t tape the box for me. None of the guys in this Officer friendly every time I get one of them they are rude and condescending. Every time I get one of the females they’re super nice and friendly.

name: james griffin
text: All of the associates at this location has helped me so much with all of my personal and business shipping needs that I don't deal with any other UPS location. The only exception to this rule I have to due to my location at the time I need something shipped or need shipping supplies for a later shipment date..  This is also the only location that is close to my home and business.

resp.text: Thank You James! Please come back and see us anytime. We are here for all your business needs! Have a great weekend!

name: Veronica Kott
text: First: The delivery driver threw my package on to the porch. Second: He left as fast as he could for what reason I couldn't say but not professional at all. Third: He didn't look or care where he delivered it to. It was thrown at a neighbors home. In fact, this is the second time this has been done. I have to say is thank goodness for nice neighbors and UPS should rethink their hiring policies.

name: Nancy Phelps
text: My second time at this store, staff very friendly. Also found out they are under new management. Definitely recommend this store.

name: Joel Lee
text: Walked in to get 2 pages printed, which I do from time to time at different locations. They told me it would cost $7.00 to do this. I said no thanks. Across street at Office Depot it was .34. Why does this location charge so much compared to their other locations?

name: Robyn Brackin
text: The details should actually say “closes at 5:50” instead of 6:00.  We went to this location at 10 till 6 with our items and the door was locked.  When the gentleman came to the door he informed us he had already “shut down his computer and to come back tomorrow at 7:30am”.   I told him I was leaving for Atlanta earlier than that and had googled what time this store closed before making the trip here today.   Didn’t matter.    Computer was closed.  I informed him of the time but like I said - it didn’t matter.    Will not use this location again.

name: Angela Serigny
text: The first experience I had at this UPS store was good however everything since the initial visit has been a long process with the main UPS Company denying my partial refund claim. I received a call today and they told me that I was going to receive a partial refund directly from the manager of this store because of what happened and that he only wanted to keep his customers happy. Now that's how you do good business, a special thanks to him.

name: Mark Scheffler
text: I needed some documents printed so I could sign and fax back to Texas. Both employees stepped up to assist me with the printing and faxing and I was in and out in 20 minutes. I’ll use this location, again!!

name: Cody H
text:
I used to use this store anytime I could due to its location and the capacities it presents itself to have, however, my last few visits will most likely be the last time I go.
Reasons being:
* Prices have gone up drastically compared to other shipping options around town.
* Service on Saturdays is very slow due to only having a single employee working.
*Computer systems seem to be running on a well-outdated Windows7 format and printing equipment was probably invented by Gutenberg.

The employees seem nice and are trying to hold things together, but they have seemed to be constantly overwhelmed during each of my last three visits. Word of advice to management/ owners: "Take care of your employees, and they'll be happy to take care of your customers." I would really love to see this store make a turnaround, but it's not something I'll be holding my breath for anytime in the near future.

name: Andrew Algaze
text:
STAY AWAY FROM THIS STORE!!!! THESE PEOPLE ARE SCAM ARTISTS.

I ship from UPS weekly and their associate Tina tried to charge me $65.00 for shipping that routinely costs me $20-$30. She was polite and friendly to me at first but then became rude and obstinate when I asked her why it was costing me so much to ship this package and lied to me when I challenged her on it. The only reason we settled on the $39.00 total is because I had to catch a flight from the airport. UPS stores are franchise owned and because the franchise itself is a scam many owners must turn to this tactic I get that they have to make money but it's no stretch to say that charging $10 for an 85¢ box is criminal. I'd love to think that the owner of this store would want to do something about this but he'll probably just give her a gold star on the wall.

name: Brandon Badon
text:
Attempted to drop off a package 10 minutes until 6pm (the closing time) the door was locked and the cage around the counter closed, I look at the time and at the closing time on the window and sure enough they had closed early. I looked through the window and the woman behind the counter shakes her head no. I show her that all labels are prepared and all she needed to do was scan the label and take the box, shakes her head no. I plead with the woman in gesture ,but still her and the 2 other employees staring at me from behind the counter were unwavering in there decision to leave me locked out in the cold rain. So here I am typing this in my car. 0 out of 5
12/13/19

name: John Roberson
text: Make the extra drive to the Old Shell location. They will go out of their way to assist you.

name: shelly fortner
text: Horrible customer service. Rude and lazy employees. Id advise folks to use a different location. These people are awful.

name: xtianne18
text:
My package, which contained essential medications, arrived a week late despite paying over $200 for the UPS Express Service (2-day shipment). I have requested for a refund on the service itself, and 1 of the staff promised that a check with the appropriate refund should arrive in our mail. Sad to say, it's been over 2 months and we have never received a check from the party. I've asked my sister to follow up on my behalf (since I am living in Canada) and she went there almost every other week. I've been calling as well, but nobody answers the phone.

I am just disappointed.

name: T-N-TByTracia !!
text:
Very rude and unprofessional staff.
I do not recommend this location

name: Ryan Goggans
text:
Just went in to ship an item. The "lady" working, when confronted with something she was unfamiliar with, was extremely rude, condescending, and confrontational. I was humiliated in front of other customers because this woman didn't know her job and was unwilling to look into the issue further - shipping via Mercari.
She used phrases such as "uh, not happening"; the "owner only has a few franchises so you need to go to a corporate location"; after scanning the code from Mercari giving her instructions "I've never seen this before. Not happening. Don't know what to tell you. You need to go somewhere else."

DISGUSTING display of "customer service". I seriously felt almost scolded by bringing something to her that she didn't know how to do. This happened at roughly 12:15 on Saturday, April 13th, 2019. Hopefully the owner will see this and take action against this employee. She seems to think that by knowing the owner she's exempt from basic human kindness, never mind customer service. I should NEVER leave a business that I'm willing to give money to feeling the way I did today.
I HAVE had great experiences at this location, however. It all depends on the employee. And quite obviously, today's employee needs to be away from people. I understand everyone has bad days, but her behavior is still inexcusable. She was relentless in shutting me down and getting me out of the store because she got flustered about not knowing what to do.

name: Ecko Udezeh
text: i had my friend ship my package to me from Alabama to an APO address for armed forces Europe, first they overcharged her according to USPS it was 114 but UPS charged me 230. Second, they didn't fill out the paperwork correctly so now we don't even know where the package is. UPS says USPS picked it up but the tracking says they have yet to pick it up. USPS says they have not gotten the package, so basically my 150 gift is lost for my daughter for Christmas and i'm out 230 dollars for shipping. I would never use them to ship and I will not give up on getting my refund and my product replaced. Corporate has been called and trust and believed I will keep going up the chain until its fixed

name: Frankie Price
text: Had a drop--off. Was greeted when I entered and treated very well. The manager noticed a lady had a FedEx shipping label, he politely made her aware of it, keeping her from waiting in line. Plus provided directions to their location.

name: Raechel Rodriguez
text:
I went to this UPS location to mail a package to Germany,  the lady in there wasn't very helpful she almost didn't make me pay it was a good thing I asked for a tracking number and then she realized that I never paid for the package, she acted like she was on drugs..
fast forward $230.00 and 7 days later the package is considered lost, according to UPS it was picked up, according to USPS it was not, so when I called to speak to the manager that helped me, they told me she had gotten fired, ( in a matter of 7 days) the " Brandy" woman had NO idea how to help me, put me on hold 5 times for over 10 minutes each time, swore on the phone, and was ill mannered. then finally after getting through to "Randy" he assured me the package was not in there. except before they were so busy they couldn't look. then magically, they looked and didn't find it, so basically now i'm out 230$ my friends kids not getting her Christmas present, shes out $150 on the gift, and there is a lost hoover board some where floating around in thin air..

I would suggest  if your shipping anything that is expensive or want it delivered on time, not to go here. they are unprofessional, rude, and unorganized.

name: Tracy Johnson
text: The service is great however the shipping prices  are high. USPS is alot cheaper.

name: Jennifer Loden
text: Didn't  have my stuff ready after dropping it 5 hours earlier, then the machine broke and it wasn't complete. Now I have to go to FedEx anyway. Wasted trip all around. Did get 30% off my order given back but sometimes that doesn't always make things right. People usually take stuff there that is important and it would be great if it were treated that way.

name: ashley hoven
text: I think that it is great that this location opens at 7:30am

name: thesalesteamllc
text: Terrible people.  They quoted myvhusband 45.00 then  charged my husband for the highest amount possible to ship a package that usually takes 1 to 2 days anyway.  (92.00) When i went to pick package up and ship it alternatively 15 minutes later... the manager said it was already gone and they couldnt give me my package back and the driver wouldnt bring it back.  They deserve a ZERO rating for being crooks and poor customer service.

name: It's Us!
text: Called and verified that they have a notary at this location. Drove 45 miles, met with a person whom needed to sign an adoption consent for a child we are adopting.  Was told by the young girl working that the "notary was busy loading a truck, but would be available tomorrow".  When asked if the notary could spare 3 minutes, was told no.   So much for The UPS Store being there when really needed.

name: Carley Pekelder
text: Will never go back. Wasted $40 on 2nd day delivery for perishable goods when they put SIGNATURE REQUIRED on the package and they didn't at least let me know so I could notify the recipient. Cookies ruined, father's day ruined, $40 gone. And this is the second time this has happened!

name: Heidi B
text: Friendly and helpful staff!

name: IVIr Demon
text: Dropped off a package an was told I couldn't get a receipt

name: Clifford Robinson
text:
Seven dollars to print a label
I got charge $14 for a service

name: Sonya Roman
text: Great service very pleasant people.

name: Martha Dees
text: Great people ready to help in any capacity!!!

name: Gina Dickens
text: Very rude people!

name: Ricky Truong
text: These guys just lock the door in front of my face 2 mins before closing time.

resp.text: Dear Mr. Truong: First, We appreciate your time, feedback, concerns as well as your business. Our policy is to be Open from 8:00 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Monday through Fridays and Saturdays 9:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. Our Computers shut down promptly at 6:30 during the week. The issue you have raised is being reviewed via our In-house 24 Hr Video Camera System plus through our Electronic Door Locking Timing System which also tracks our closure times. We will address our closures times again with all Staff to ensure we abide by our posted closing times. We apologize for any inconvenience(s) you have encountered and look forward to seeing you in the future. Most Sincerely, Jim Rice, Manager.

name: Lynn Wickman
text: Never answer their phone. Shipping prices are insanely high.

name: Bill Campbell
text: NO NOTARY AS ADVERTISED. They don’t send to be good. Not so much under new management. did I mention NO NOTARY?

name: tony vanzant
text: always very helpful,

name: Kenny Hunter
text: Very rude when asking a question

resp.text: Dear Mr. Hunter: First we apologize that you feel that you and your question was not properly addressed or answered in a positive response or manner. In this fast-paced environment where customers rush in and want to conduct their business and be on their way as soon as practical, it may seem that less time is spent on a particular issue. Regardless though please know that your needs are very important to us. Now there have been times where a Customer may come in and unintentionally speak out and over other customers while Staff members are already working directly with the customer in front of them so then a speedy response by the Staff to a question may seem short, but our goal is always to provide the information that you may need. To provide a Positive Customer Service Experience is why we train and what we always strive to provide. Again, we appreciate your business and look forward to seeing you again. I will also be glad to personally discuss this further with you at any time. Most Sincerely, Jim Rice, Manager.

name: Evelyn Ellzey
text: Excellent service!!

name: Roberta Goins
text: I had some packages there to pickup the lady in there was sweet and got my packages for me. I am thankful I have some place close toy home that can keep packages and hold them till I go pick them up that way no one can steal them off of my porch if I am gone. Thank you UPS Store

name: David Warren
text: There is a muscular guy with a light beard. Dude, you don't belong there. Crawl back into your mommy's basement. Stay there, don't ever come out. This world is better off without you.

name: David Allain
text:
Started my journey with renting a UHAUL truck and trailer two weeks before the move. Megan was very knowledgeable and helped me make the right truck size choice. Unfortunately, the uhaul reservation system was down that day so I reserved from home later that week.

For some reason the “traffic” division of UHAUL that is not based in Auburn changed my reservation the day before and I was going to have to go to Phoenix City to pick up a truck, and Opelika to pick up the trailer. Ended up working with Hunter King and Hugh three times in one day, the day before the rental pickup date, to iron out my issues.

Hunter gave the info for traffic try and get it sorted out, which eventually did work. There wasn’t anything he could do to add my reservation to the store because they were out of truck. By an act of God someone canceled later and I got the truck I needed at this location. Then “traffic” moved it again..

Needless to say. Hunter K. was knowledgeable, patient, and extremely helpful in getting the reservation squared away again and even helped add an extra day to my reservation so I could get the truck immediately.

11/10 recommend this store because of the employees Megan, Hunter K., and Hugh.

I say everything here to show you how much of a hassle it can be to reserve online. If you can reserve in-person at this store it will save SOOO many headaches.

War Damn Eagle

name: Tuyen_2000
text: Paperwork got messed up and I got charged for 460 miles instead of the 30 I did. Seem to think it's perfectly fine to do 460 miles in six hours and refuse to refund the couple hundred dollars they overcharged. Just rent a truck, don't come here.

name: joy G
text:
Best service Ever. Megan is the best
She is so friendly and helpful
I would like to give more than 5 stars
Box Truck rental was efficient and well run.
Fast and efficient. Customer service courteous and professional.
Highly recommended

name: Amber K
text: They are the absolute worst! I've never met a set of ruder people in my life. If you can't go to another uhaul location just pick Budget or Penske and save yourself the headache.

name: Jerry F
text: Megan is the best.  Never expected such friendly and incredible service when I needed help moving my son in to college.  Thank you so much for your help Megan.  You made my day and my week easier.  Highly recommend.

name: Nick Britton
text: Super friendly and helpful staff. I had to go into the store multiple times and interacted with several different people. They were all courteous.

name: Mohammadnaser Ansari
text: I had some issues with the truck and the roadside assistance was completely useless. They did not have any service available in Auburn at the time (near downtown). However, the lady in charge of the store was exceptionally helpful (didn't get the name). The only reason I will rent again is only for the great customer service in the store.

name: Pierce M
text: Hunter is a great employee. Super helpful and a good communicator which made renting / returning a breeze.

name: N Stovah
text: Hunter was excellent. Very friendly and knowledgeable. Deserves a big raise.

name: Leonard Sloan
text: Quick fast and easy service

name: Laurie Hillanbrand
text: A No Show. We made a reservation for a Move In date for a Saturday. The woman who took the information said they are no longer open on a Saturday, but she would make the exception for this time. She gave us her personal cell phone number and asked if we would call 15 minutes before arrival and she would meet us to sign the paper work. We did just that, no one picked up, but we left a message. We arrived with a dorm room full of stuff to store for the summer and we called again, no answer. The sign on the door of the office said they were closed but to call the number (her number)AND the national number, which is what we did. The Representative for the national number said the U-HAUL company doesn't allow their storage buildings to close on a Saturday and that they couldn't do more to help us. So while we waited for a return phone call, we started looking at other storage places near by and STOR-EAGLE Storage was able to accommodate us with no problems! At the time of this review it has been almost 5 hours since we left a message at U-HAUL Moving & Storage of Auburn and we still did not get a return phone call. Make a reservation at your own risk.

name: Rachel Sugg
text:
My husband and I chose to use Uhaul for our move because it was the best affordable option. For future moves we will do everything we can to avoid working with them again.

After making a reservation a month in advance, we found that our truck had been double booked and watched it be given to someone else right in front of us. When asked for some kind of alternative or assistance, the man who was supposed to be helping us simply told us, “That’s too bad,” and that we could call the national Uhaul line. Because our state is becoming overwhelmed with COVID-19 cases, we used the Uhaul app to check in and pick up the truck. However, the man helping us said that we should have come inside (where not a single employee was masked) if we wanted the truck. We understand that this situation may not have been this individual’s fault, but his behavior made our situation even more distressing, as he was quite rude, even belligerent, and made no attempt at an apology for this very disruptive mistake.

This mixup has made our lives very difficult, and we were sorely disappointed in the employee’s attitude toward us. In the future, we will not be using Uhaul, and from now on we will be warning others about this.

name: Chelsea Clayton
text: I have rented uhaul trailers before but I have never had an experience like this one! The employees absolutely knocked my socks off!! Brandon, Megan, and Blake have absolutely made this experience the best I have ever had.  I will definitely come back to this location for all my rental needs!!

name: Space Cadet
text: Great service and very friendly. Have dropped off Uhauls twice here in the past month.

name: Corey Harris
text:
We waited in the store for 10 mins until
Someone walked in from the back to help. We did the scan and go on the app, and the man still wanted to verify our items and print a confirmation. Why do scan and go if you have to wait in line anyways?

name: Gopal Nath
text: I reserved 15’ truck.  Before  picking up they assigned me 26’  truck instead,  saying that 15’ not available.

name: Zongru Han
text: Worst service ever, staff is rude and they wouldn’t talk to you for more than 10min

name: Jose Torres
text: Uhaul's online booking system made some major errors on my booking, but I had a ton of time-saving help from the staff at this location. They helped me get the correct size truck for my move.

name: Cal Warriner
text: Could not have been better. Guy behind counter was quick and efficient. Guy who hooked trailer up just as good. In and out in 20 minutes including purchase of wardrobes, tape, boxes and part for hitch.

name: William Paris
text: Megan was very helpful and the store had everything I needed. Thank you. I wasn't expecting such a pleasant experience.

name: James S
text: Unable to complete reservation because "keys were lost by last person to use the van." First, there should be duplicates. Second, I was called the morning I was supposed to move. Why even bother guaranteeing something that is not there? After cancelling my reservation and having me go around town looking for a same-day, 3x more rental, the location did not even tell me about the U-Haul program that gives partial reimbursements for failed guarantees.

name: Paramjit “Perry” Kahai, PhD
text:
The rep who assisted me at this store is a tall, bearded man.  As soon as he handed me the truck, I took a picture of the odometer. On the contract, he had mileage out that was lower than what I saw before I started moving. The mileage out should be the odometer mileage when the truck is handed to the customer, not the mileage that may be on their records when the truck was returned by a previous customer.

Also, unknown to me, there was a dolly in the back that I had not even reserved.  I saw it only when I opened the back to load my stuff.  I was surprised, to say the least and wondered if I will be billed for it. Guess what?  I was billed for it even though I had not used it. And how did he know that I had used it? When I called this morning, he told me that the plastic tab that was attached to the dolly was broken. When I try to assure him that I had not even touched the dolly, his response was rude and something like "we have a lot of customers who say they didn't use the dolly but they actually did." In short, he had just accused me of lying!  My question is: why was the dolly even there in the first place? I had not reserved it!  And if there was something in the back of the truck, he should have opened the back and shown it to me.  I would have asked for the dolly to be taken out. Further, how do I know that tab wasn't broken before the truck keys were handed to me? So, this was a clear case of an attempt to cheat a customer.  I wonder how many people this store rep has cheated.  Next time, if I ever rent again from this location (which I very much doubt) or any other, I will make certain to open the back and have them remove any extra stuff I did not order!

Any attempts at talking with the rep over the phone was met with rude, curt, and insulting responses.  The phone call was recorded by the location, so that will provide evidence of whether I am telling the truth about the rep's attitude and lack of respect towards me.

BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU RENT A TRUCK AT THIS LOCATION. INSPECT EVERYTHING BEFORE YOU LEAVE AND HAVE THEM REMOVE EVERYTHING YOU HAD NOT RESERVED.

name: Shari Belton
text: The General Manager greets you at the door. I had a reservation to pick up a trailer for my son and later found out it wasn't needed. The store was able to refund my money within two days, even though I purchased a one-way rental. Be sure to stop by there for all of your rental needs!

name: John Parker
text: Without a doubt, the most unprofessional outfit of workers I've ever witnessed behind a single desk. My sister went into the store to complete the very routine process of accessing her storage unit. However, unbeknownst to her or anyone else, they were full and instead rerouted her reservation to Georgia. This information was not even gathered until they second attempt to receive help from the desk, for the first time we spoke to their general manager, Tavon Scott, who was at the moment in no mood to do his job. As soon as he saw that our last name did not come up in the computer, he looked at us as if we were crazy and then proceeded to profusely rid himself of all blame ("it was the call center") and yelled at us for becoming frustrated at the fact that we seemingly had no storage. He was completely unwilling to make up for the fault of his company in any capacity and did nothing but sit there and act annoyed at our frustration. I dropped by one last time to use the restroom and I could hear them quoting us and laughing at our situation until they saw I had come in. I was so disgusted at their attitude about their job that I marched up to the desk to get Mr. Scott's full name to write in this report, to which he replied, laughing "You can just look up my name if you need it." I replied "take care" and he replied "oh I will take care" and continued to murmur something under his breath to the amusement of his coworkers. I've never held an official job to this date, but if I talked half as rudely to any customer as they did to us, I'd expect to be canned on the spot, and that's exactly what I wish upon this man, Mr. Scott. I'd equate this crew to a group of shiftless, gawky teenagers who are too immature to own up to their own shortcomings. Simply put, these insolent fools don't know how to represent a company and don't appreciate the name stitched onto their shirt. They've made a decision to be bad at what they do. One star for knowing English.

name: Mark Gallagher
text: My reserved trailer was rented to another person which sent it over 90 miles away.   However, since we all remained calm; they worked with us and gave us a 17 foot truck which worked out so much better than a small trailer.  It had better gas milage, great air conditioning, and we didn't need to pay extra for a logistical error.  Thanks guys at Auburn U-Haul for making my move stress free and helping out even though you really didn't need to....

name: Christopher Abreu
text: I had reserved a truck a month in advance, only to have it redirected from this location to another 45 minutes away the day before my move. They claim they were “overbooked”, even though they confirmed the reservation to me over the phone earlier in the week, and was not updated online until after the email. Calling the office takes you to their call center, where you either get someone that is willing to help or someone that hangs up on you. I would not recommend bringing your business here, as the overall experience was unprofessional, sloppy, and infuriating.

name: Whitney Mullins
text: I reserved a self-storage climate control unit with U-Haul on February 1st. I kept the email confirmation and went by to make sure everything was in order so my roommate could begin moving their stuff into storage. After twenty minutes of waiting in line I showed them the email and asked how to go about getting access to the unit since I had never done this before. The man looked up everything and said I was nowhere in the system. I showed him the confirmation and everything that was needed and he said he was sorry, but there was nothing he could do. The manager came out and said that they have not had the climate control storage for over two months now. I told him I have had the unit reserved since February and received no notice that anything was changed. I even called two days ago checking to make sure and the lady said everything was fine. I asked them if they could help me out because I had to find somewhere to put the items because I have to be moved out by noon tomorrow and cannot move into my new place until August 15. They said they could not help me and turned me away. I will never use the company of U-Haul again. There was only one storage unit available in the city of Auburn, and it was at Uncle Bob's storage. The only reason they had it available was because someone cancelled an hour before I called. Thank goodness for that.

name: Randy Mauldin
text:
I rented a 26' truck today. You double billed my credit card. I should have known that you were a disreputable business when Michael asked me for my credit card without quoting me a price. Since you are a monopoly I guess you think that people will pay any amount of money to rent a truck.
He then quoted me a price which I agreed to. I found out when I picked up the truck that he conveniently failed to tell me that there is a hidden fee of $0.99 a mile. WOW, now you have added $80 in hidden fees.
I started to cancel the reservation but then I remembered that you are the only place that rents moving equipment. I had to move so I was stuck with the extortion.
Since you are greedy bastards, you decide to go ahead and stick it to me. You double billed my credit card to make up for the frustration of dealing with an unhappy customer.
Rest assured that this isn't the end of the case. I will contact my credit card company and I will make sure that all of the milage charge is reversed as well as the double billing. When you quote a price, you must honor it.

name: Casten FIscher
text: I use this place frequently to get trailers for hauling things.  They usually have the trailers I need, and they are usually quick to get me in and out.  I have been to other uhaul centers who are not helpful at all, so it is refreshing to go here.

name: Gullatte Acres
text: I dropped off a trailer and had excellent service.

name: Elliott Wood
text: Staff doesn't know squat about their products. The lady on the phone said i would need to buy transmission fluid for my trailer hitch. Recommend a different dealer.

name: nicole gathe
text: Brad was great! He got us in and out when we picked up and returned. No issues with prices or quotes. A+

name: Jared Hawsey
text: Rented a trailer and they were very nice and quick. In and out in a flash

name: Jerrell Knight
text: Worst customer experience I EVER had. Customer service rep did not want to do his job and tried to stale so he wouldn't have to do his job.

name: Andypatt43
text: Went into store to get wiring for my trailer hitch.  After about 30 mins and no employees in the store to help the 5-7 people that had accumulated behind me in line.  When the guy came back out to help me he said I must talk to installation tech.  When the tech came out bout 10 mins later he proceeds to tell me that I can't make a reservation in the store I had to do it on-line.(just to get me out if store I think).     After calling customer care they told me this was absurd u must make appointment in store.  So long story short their a bunch of lazy people that wanna do nothing.  They also told me that it would take an hour, but the service rep on phone said 4 hours and would be $210.00 plus parts and wire.   Called CTU(CUSTOM TRUCKS UNLIMITED) RIGHT up the street and they install for $125.00 parts and all.  Never ever using these morons again. And the tech should be reprimanded for lying to customer to get out of work!  Never going back.  Customer service goes along way and they have None!

name: Curtis Keller
text: Nice team.  Very customer centered

name: Garrett Vickery
text: Van rental was easy and pretty quick. Returned it afterhours and didnt have to go through any sort of checkin process.

name: Felecia Brock
text: They have alot to offer when moving.

name: Gerry Hicks
text: Made a reservation for a uhaul truck and they did not honor it. Then after I called them out for there wrong doing they took no blame. At least if you are going to not honor a reservation own up to it.

name: Ethan Parker
text: They said I had a truck (I reserved 3 weeks in advance), then they changed the size I was set to pick up, upped the rate, then said they didn't have a truck. Do not waste your time.

name: jerrilynn freeman
text: If you want to move in town or out of town or even out of state they have a plan for you. Ask about there one way drop off

name: Seyun Oh
text: The hitch was carelessly done and the wire was torn. It has been only a week and I didn't even get to use it once. Very disappointing and time consuming that it need to get fixed.

name: Emily Hamilton
text: Went to return a vehicle and waited over 45 minutes for anyone to even come to the counter to help me.

name: Brenda McCarthy
text: Recommend to EVERYONE

name: Amelia Trenga
text: Came in day of and they accommodated us well

name: Debra Abu-Dames
text: Friendly staff...above and beyond.

name: Kathryn McCoy

name: Glenn Riggs
text: Blackbox self storage is an amazing facility. Great management, works with you to take care of your needs. Renting and move in are simple because Jesse does whatever it takes to accommodate your move in or out. The facility is clean and well lit. The security both video and individually alarmed units allow you peace of mind.  24 hour access as well as many great occupants make it an awesome experience. It’s the only storage I’ve ever used that has a light switch rather than a timer, also has an outlet in the unit and access to water nearby. I just can’t say enough about this business. They treat you as friends and help in any way possible. I’ll certainly use them again if needed and tell everyone about them. Thanks so much Jesse.

name: Lauren Hardison
text: We rented a climate controlled unit for right at a year after we sold our house. The owner is super friendly, but the security and cleanliness is what won me over!! The automatic security that each unit has with the main gait relieved my fears of anyone breaking into our unit. It’s very well lit, so anytime I needed to go in the evenings I had absolutely no worries! Would certainly recommend this for all your storage needs!!

name: Kelli Malace
text: We originally chose Black Box Storage for the location and security. We found that the owners were wonderful to work with as well! We will definitely use them again in the future for our storage needs.

name: timothy whiteside
text: Excellent customer service the attendant was very polite and respectful, very knowledgeable about the size I needed to accommodate my belongings, A-1 Service.

name: Megan W
text:
I recently brought in a bunch of Amazon returns for processing, and the manager Flin completed the transactions very quickly and then went above and beyond to prevent me from making a mistake that would have necessitated a second trip to the store and generally ruined my day.

Aside from that great experience last week, all of my other interactions with this store have also been quick and easy. I definitely recommend this place. The only negative about it is that the location is often surrounded by dense traffic and never ending construction. I will continue to do my business here despite that slight inconvenience; the competent and efficient customer service is worth it.

name: Alexander Marbut
text: I'd be weary that the positive reviews here are coming from in-store. I've always been a big fan of online shopping, and before moving to Tuscaloosa I had all my packages delivered by UPS with no problems. Since moving here, every single item I have ordered has come with some problem or other. Every package looks like they were playing football with it behind the store before delivering. I had a high end TV delivered with the screen shattered right out of the box. I actually returned that one, relabelled it, and marked through all old labels with black sharpie--and they delivered it back to my door the next day, drenched in rain. I had to take off work twice to return the same item. Now they won't even deliver to my address--they see I live in a gated apartment, give up, and drop my packages off to be picked up at stores all over Tuscaloosa (CVS, Michaels). So now, every order, I have to spend hours trying to track down where they left my package. The order I picked up today from Michaels was mislabelled, so instead of a tablet I got an Apple TV that I now have to take off work (again) to return. I'm done taking off work to fix their mistakes--I will be paying extra money from now on if I have to just to use another delivery service.

name: Steve B.
text: they've been great - I have a mailbox there for packages and they know my face/number by heart when I walk in haha Shipping and shredding has always gone smoothly too

name: chasdon breland
text: Customer service is great! The staff is eager to help all needs and find a solution to every problem as long as the customer is willing.

name: Austin Smith
text: The staff was super polite and friendly, and were very efficient in assisting me while sending my package.

name: Sheree Johnson
text: The staff is very friendly and fast. They gave me great service.

name: matthew fox
text: I've had a box there for years. The service is great, the staff has gotten to know me and is always very attentive. It's a 5 star store for sure, if it wasn't for the 1 star parking. But being in the shadow of Bryant Denny Stadium, one doesn't expect much there. Over all great experience at this store.

name: Cam Alexander
text:
I’m pretty upset. I’ve never had problems at this location before. I brought in a package that is time sensitive from a student book company. I’m now being charged the full price of my textbook because UPS never sent it out. It’s been 20 days and the package should have been back at the facility in three days. They refused to tell me what happened to the package and won’t find out why the tracking number isn’t working. Never going to this location again.

UPDATE - the textbook company isn’t charging me anymore due to negligence of UPS, so that’s one less thing to worry about. Still wouldn’t recommend taking important items to this location.

name: J.K. Terrell
text: Slow plus will not the phone
