name: Tiffany Nguyen
text: The two woman and man that worked at UPS, they are the sweetest and most understanding people ever. I had to drop off two packages returning to amazon and I also had an incident with my car and told them about it and asked for their advice. I’m 20 and I have a kid with me and I basically ran over a pothole resulting my passenger car tires to be flattened. They let me stay until closing because I came around 5:30pm and they stayed with me until 6:10pm because outside was extremely hot. The tow truck came and got me and I thanked those two women who were extremely helpful! Thank you again UPS ladies!

resp.text: Thank you, Ms. Nguyen.  We are very pleased that you had a good experience with The UPS Store personnel.  Please let us know if you need anything else in the future.  The management team.

name: Dennis Duran
text: I love this place. Everyone is efficient and genuinely nice at the same time.  You must visit this UPS Store and you'll see what I am talking about.  Don't believe the bad reviews.  Go see for yourself!

resp.text: Thank you so much, Dennis.  This is how we want to provide customer service, service with a smile!  The owners.

name: Jessica
text: Very nice and friendly. Quick service for what I needed!

resp.text: Thank you very much, Jessica.  We all work very hard every single day to provide excellent service and, at the same time, try to get the job done quickly so you can go on with your day. If you ever have any questions or need anything, please do not hesitate to let us know.  The owners.

name: Leighton Kellett
text: They were very rude and actually said they were refusing me service and the lady picked up my box that wasn’t taped and dropped the $1200 tripod that inside. I will never go back here again. The Saraland store has always had way better service than these inconsiderate people...

name: Eugene Roberts
text: Very rude to customers and to other employees. This business needs to be reevaluated by UPS. I would give negative stars if I could. Never will be back. I think the rude lady is the owner if not she said she was (older lady with glasses). She wasn't even the one helping me.

resp.text: Mr. Roberts - We are very sorry for your negative experience at The UPS Store and will strive to improve customer satisfaction.  The owners.

name: Aalyia Shaukat
text: Awesome service. Drive out of my way for this ups store because they're very helpful and encourage their patrons to wear masks before entering the store -- something especially important during the holiday season! Feels much safer that way. Would highly recommend.

resp.text: Aalyia, you made my day!  I am so happy that you are pleased with our service.  Thank you for taking time out of your day to rate our business.  Ms. Rasool - Owner

name: Lisa Sheets
text: I was humiliated by a female employee when I entered, will never enter this store again. I had my mask on but it wasn’t on tight enough for her. She was panicking and wanting me to fix it and I was trying to make it tighter. She looked so afraid so I tried to ease her mind by letting her know I already had Covid (was quarantined all alone at Christmas) and she called me a liar. She made me go outside and change my mask to one of hers.  No customer should ever be treated this way. I will use USPS or Fed Ex from here on out.

resp.text: We apologize you are unhappy with your visit.  The pandemic has been a big stressor for everyone.

name: Martrisse Haynes
text:
The lady Regina is extremely rude to customers and her employees. I hate this location is so close to my home but moving forward, I will drive further to be treated with decency. Per recent reviews, I can see this isn’t an isolated experience and something needs to be done about how she treats people. Also, she should be mindful about following people to their car to continue trying to explain her invalid point.
Edit: in Regina’s response, she states she carried my trampoline to the car. She did not, one of her male associates carried it. Also, I waited 30 mins and Regina said she was a packaging expert but I should continue to wait for her husband to return to find a box for it to fit in. Waiting 30 mins is not me being in a rush, this was my SECOND attempt at getting a box at this location. I can’t believe she would blatantly lie. After 30 mins and her following me to my car, I went to Saraland and was able to get my box packaged within 5 mins. I have a positive review posted there.

name: vera bettin
text: Don’t waste your time!

name: BJ Blackwell
text: Terrible experience in every way.  I was simply trying to get some documents notarized and I completely felt like I was in the twilight zone.   They charged me $70 UPFRONT before the notary service was complete without an invoice or any service fee chart so I knew what I was paying for AFTER I had to leave and come back because I had signed the “non-notarized” documents before I got there and had to go back to Office Depot to reprint the 36+ pages.  The owners wife (at least I think she was) was loud and rude to at least 3 of the customers while I was there (including me) over their face mask and another guy a signed document and seemed like she was on something based off of her demeanor and disposition.   The same thing happened to another customer while I was there as she quickly and loudly yelled “IT’S ILLEGAL SIR!!” because his document he had was signed in a “non-notary” place with more than 5 customers in the business.   I was embarrassed for them, the young employees that were being trained that this is classified as customer service, and myself for sharing the same air as these total and complete morons.

resp.text: Mr. Blackwell - We would like to apologize for your negative experience at our store.  I'd like to learn more about your specific situation and make things right.  Please contact me at 251-460-4096 at your earliest convenience.  I look forward to speaking with you and resolving any misunderstandings.  Ms. Rasool

name: Hina Q
text: Convenient location and a lot of services provided. I'm always pleased with the service I get here.

resp.text: Thank you so much, Hina.  We are happy to hear that you are pleased with our service!  The Owners

name: Margaret Elizabeth
text: I’ve made my point.  Perhaps you will think about how you treat customers in the future. Regina Rasool, be honest with yourself AND others. And learn to be kind and fair.

resp.text: Please call 800-742-5877 for any delivery issues

name: benali hassen
text: I want to buy Samsung Galaxy Note 10 Plus. Please, how much? Can you send to Algeria? Thank you so much

resp.text: Mr. Hassen, thank you for your review.  We'll be happy to help you with your request; however, please visit The UPS Store in person and someone will help you purchase a cell phone and we will also check the country regulations to be sure you can ship your cell phone to Algeria.  Best Regards - Regina Rasool, Owner

name: Nasir Awan
text: Was pleasantly surprised by the friendliness of the staff the first time I used their sometime back.  Have been going there since then and always walk out with a smile.  Very friendly and helpful staff.

resp.text: Thank you, Sir!  We appreciate both your business and taking time out of your day to let us know how we're doing!  Best Regards, and have a great day!  Ghulam & Regina Rasool, Owners - The UPS Store

name: al huda
text: This establishment is very unprofessional and doesn’t know how to separate business and relationships. I wouldn't go back in any occasion. I went in for an interview and they refused to give me a chance because of false conflicts that they claimed has to do with me.

resp.text: UPS - Disgruntled applicant who wasn't hired as an employee

name: Jennifer Marie Wesson
text: Kenzie and Hannah are always super helpful and nice! I literally love going to mail my stuff there! They’re amazing! I highly recommend them! :)

resp.text: We really appreciate your feedback.  We love our customers!  If we are ever anything but excellent, don't hesitate to let me know.  Thanks again.  Regina Rasool, Owner-The UPS Store.

name: Mesha McDonald
text: TERRIBLE SERVICE! I recently visited this location and the owner was incredibly RUDE! I was not quite ready to be checked out and he told me and I quote "I can't stand here all day and wait on you." I politely asked him to calm down because I wasn't asking him too. He proceeded to raise his voice at me and threaten to kick me out of the store! His response was completely over the top and unwarranted! I will NEVER be visiting this location again! I have been to other locations and I have never had a bad experience or been so disrespected.

resp.text: Ms. McDonald, I'm happy that my associate, Christian, was able to spend at least 15 minutes helping you with your Amazon return, but I am not happy that you left unsatisfied.  You may contact us at store2350@theupsstore.com for us to help you resolve any issues at hand.

name: Justin imsand
text: This store is by far the worst I have ever stepped foot in. Ran by a husband and wife. If the husband would admit the wife into a retirement home for crazy people and keep her out of this store he would surely see a extreme increase in revenue.

resp.text: Mr. Imsand, we're sorry you feel the way you do.  We are, unfortunately, short staffed this week due to a death in the family of an employee, coupled with being extremely busy.  We apologize for your untoward experience in our store.  Please contact us at 460-4096 or store2350@theupsstore.com so that we can clear up any misunderstandings you may have regarding this UPS Store.  Thank You Sir - The owners

name: Noell Espaillat
text:
I am so thankful to Kenzie and Aysha for their help today! I went to another postal carrier and they wanted to charge me $170 per package for a $25 little blanket! So I left and went to the UPS store and they were so nice and helpful and I shipped both packages and got a book of stamps for less than $50!
On top of meeting my needs, they were very nice and helpful. Thank you ladies! I should have seen you first, this is my only stop from now on!

resp.text: Noell, it was truly a pleasure to serve you!  We would really like to see you again.  Please let us know if there's anything we can help you with.  We are very pleased that you enjoyed your visit at The UPS Store 2350 and took time to leave a Google review!  Sincerely, Regina Rasool - Owner, The UPS Store

name: Lotus
text: Went to this location to ship a very small package that was going to Poland. I was on my lunch break and was pressed for time. I waited patiently as the clerk attempted to try to figure out how the address should be input it into her system. It ended up taking about 15 minutes or so for this process. There was really no problem with this, even though it was inconvenient. However, the employee then stated you're probably not going to want to ship this once you know how much the prices to which I responded while how much is it, and she stated give me a couple of minutes and I'll tell you. I found this quite interesting as she obviously knew what the price is going to be. She ended up quoting me over $190 for the shipment!! Again one hundred and ninty dollars!.. Keep in mind that this package was about 6"x5"x2".. A very small package. She then proceeded to tell me that USPS would charge me $95 for the package. I looked at her and asked if she was joking.. No, she was not. I quickly grabbed the package and left the store. I drove over to USPS down the road and went in to have the package shipped. The total cost for priority mail ended up being $32.50. Moral of the story, this place is a huge rip-off with very inflated pricing and should not be used under any circumstances for international delivery. They obviously cannot be trusted and do not know how to correctly price and ship packages. Avoid this location, or any third-party UPS package store for that matter. Just stick with either handling it online and using it as a drop-off source or avoid it altogether.

name: Paul Thompson
text: I would give more than 5 stars if I could. Amazing customer service. I had some packages arrive on a Saturday that I was unable to pick up that I needed before my flight the next day.  I left a message on their phone and they allowed me to pick them up over 3hrs after they closed on the weekend. I have done business there before and will continue to do so in the future.  They owners who helped me were super nice.

resp.text: Thank You, Mr. Thompson.  We were happy to help you in your time of need.

name: Ellen Carter
text: I have dealt with this store for 6 years. They are family owned and operated, so they are able to provide personal service. I have sometimes been a pain in the neck customer, forgetting to bring an address or something. They will let me go ahead and leave my package and call in the address... They have held my mail for extended periods when I have been traveling... They have looked through my mail for certain deliveries for me when I have called to request that... They have even checked my amazon email for me to do a return.... Way above the average customer service. I am very glad they are there for me.

resp.text: You are so sweet, Ms. Carter!  We enjoy seeing you in our store, so don't worry.  You are no trouble to us at all!  Anything we can do to help, we'll continue to do for you.

name: Greg Hoffmann
text:
I am super impressed with the top notch customer service and the kindness of the staff at this UPS store.
This is a busy store but they always do a great job at moving things along as quickly as possible.
I would recommend this UPS store anytime!

resp.text: Thank you, Greg!

name: Michael Burke
text: Very kind and patient staff, who assisted me with my unusual predicaments with accepting and returning items over the holidays. Not sure what issues these others are reporting, perhaps just dissatisfied with UPS-wide pricing and practices.

resp.text:
Thank you so much, Mr. Burke.  If there is anything you ever need help with, please let us know.
Sincerely, Regina Rasool, Owner-The UPS Store.

name: jin lim
text:
Tried to drop off a package with a return label from something I bought online. They said it is not proper packaging and wouldn't let me drop it off. That's a lie. It was the same packaging that I received it in so that can't be improper packaging. It was literally a ups box.  They are just trying to make money from repackaging items. I guess the UPS business isn't doing so well.  There is a reason there are so many bad reviews.

edit: Owner is lying in response.

resp.text: Online businesses who ship boxes to customers do not ship using UPS branded boxes.  These boxes are exclusive for The UPS Store Franchises and affiliates only.  I am sorry for your experience, whatever that might have been.  If it was my store that you visited and had this experience, it is quite possible your box was either badly damaged or was devoid of the proper amount of packaging materials and we merely suggested that you add packaging materials.  We work hard to assure that our customers packages are packed and shipped the way we would ship our own personal packages.  If any customer is having an unpleasant experience at any UPS location, please ask to speak to the owner or manager and they will gladly be able to resolve any situation, as we never want our customers to leave unhappy.   R. Rasool, Owner, The UPS Store #2350

name: Pamela Ramos-Brown
text:
All of my experiences have been pleasant and professional.  The owners, including the family members, and the staff have been very accommodating, courteous, and genuinely friendly.

On more than one occasion they have gone above and beyond to help.  It's a great place for personal and business mail and other office services.

resp.text: Ms. Ramos Brown, I hope you are doing well.  I just wanted to take a minute to tell  you how much your positive review means to us.  It is customers like you who help us to feel positively about running a business in these hard times.  The owners

name: Aaliyah Dang
text: KENZIE IS THE BOMB DOT COM. I DEMAND HER A RAISE AND THAT’S PERIOD! She was SO helpful while I was looking hella lost! Best UPS store Everrrrr!!

resp.text: Thank You So Much, Erica.  You made our day! Owners, The UPS Store

name: Ahmad Omar
text: Best UPS store in town!! Very clean, has great customer service and is open later than all the others. Owners are very hospitable and really do care about their customers. I dont know what other people are talking about...I will not go to any other UPS store after visiting this one!

name: Ashleigh Ely
text: Awful service . They did not help me . I will never go back to this location

resp.text: Ms. Ely, I'm sorry you feel that way.  We personally make every effort to address customers needs as they enter The UPS Store.  Is it possible that we were extremely busy that day?   We would like to hear your side, so please reach out to one of the owners during regular business hours.  We would like to clear up any possible misunderstanding.  Thank you.

name: Kathy Noel
text:
Above and beyond the assistance I expected to get a package shipped out.
Please make this your first stop ....

resp.text: Thank You Kathy!  We appreciate your business and hope to see you again soon.  Regina Rasool - Owner, The UPS Store

name: Marc Lichtenberger
text: I went in to get a document notarized.  Guy made it impossible to sign a one page document.  Wanted to see other documents in escrow package that had nothing to do with the grant deed.  He was not rude though and was professional up to the point where I thought he was being overly intrusive.

name: John H
text:
Wow, this is proof that people are more likely to say something if they have something negative to say. I am an eBay seller and I have been going to this UPS Store weekly for the past 3 years and I never thought once to leave a positive review. That says it all.

The owner is super nice and he is an extremely hard worker.  In fact 1 day I came in with a bad attitude and he took the "high road" remaining calm and professional. I have regretted it ever since. As for the shipping errors, we are all human and things happen, but if this was really a problem I would know. After all, I have shipped out over a hundred items from this location with literally no issues.

I wish some of the reviewers on here would revisit their ratings. For example, 1 review said there experience was "bordering on the unfavorable" but then they left a 1 star rating. How is that possible? It also made me sad when I read the 1 star review left b/c they were upset that the workers tried to sell them their services. Please reconsider this review. They are running a business and everyone's got eat. Thanks!

resp.text: Mr. John, when reading your review from several years ago, I feel a great sense of appreciation for you taking your valuable time to write such a considerate and detailed review.  I agree with everything you have said in your review.  I hope you are doing well and we hope to see you again in the future.  The owners

name: Andrea Curtis
text: We have had to utilize this location for the past year because the UPS driver that delivers to our area refuses to leave packages at our door or in the office of our apartment complex.  Every time we have to pick up, there is some sort of problem - or they are very put out because we are asking for our package.  Most of the time things are delayed.  The staff here has been a rotating door, so usually they have to get a manager involved to answer simple questions.  Management team is incredibly rude and very condescending - to their employees and customers.

name: Sue Rollins
text: Excellent customer service.  Helpful and courteous everytime I have been in there.

name: Helena Roldan
text:
Unhelpful, rigid staff.  Today...”I cant allow you to (use our stapler or seal) your envelope package in our store.  It is against UPS policy.” But they could sell me a “self sealing envelope for $3.50.”
Every time I have to do a simple transaction with
they manage to irritate me beyond belief.

name: Ghulam Rasool
text: You may pick up someone else's My Choice or Access Point Package if you provide the tracking number.  I love this store!

name: Katy McGehee
text: By far the worst experience I've had at a ups store. Regina Rasool was incredibly rude and asked for information that did not pertain to the situation. She made us incredibly uncomfortable and was insensitive to the situation at hand. I have filed a complaint with ups and although she is the wife of the owner, I hope to have her removed from the store. The lady she "helped" in front of us, left upset as well. This woman does not need to be customer service. Ever.

name: John Kozachyn
text: Terrible customer service owner tried to hustle us and over charge worst experience ever WILL NOT be returning to that location ever again......my 5month old baby could do better! Very disappointed and upset they set me back by a few days to a week and they really don't care at all I don't recommend this store plz don't be fooled by the management they will set you or your small business back and hustle you too I guarantee!!!

name: Shane Caton
text: I asked to email the file to be printed and he said ok. Then wanted to charge me a fee to check his email to print the documents. I do this at other UPS stores FedEx Office Staples and Office Depot/Max and have never been cherry a fee for them printing from their email. I walked out.

name: Sherri Hudson
text:
If you live alone and have no access to picking up your package, nobody is allowed to pick it up for you, which is total bs. How are single people supposed to get their stuff if they're never home and have nobody "eligible" living at their address to get it? Totally biased and unfair. They want you to pay again for reshipment. A bunch of jerks.

And mediocre costumer service.

name: Chico Peebles
text: Staff is helpful and very friendly.

resp.text:
Thank You Chico.  Very nice of you to take the time to review The UPS Store.
Regina Rasool, Owner

name: Judy Williams
text:
It's a shame when you have to call the police over $7, in order to get a business owner to do what is right by the customer.

I must first say this: Not once did I raise my voice (I lost my voice so I am vocally incapable of yelling) or curse at him.

Incident: I got a POA document notarized by Razuel on Saturday, and mailed it the same to Nationwide. Nationwide Collison Manager said via email that the document was not acceptable by DMV because additional information was written on the document by Raquel. On Wednesday I return to the store and speak with his wife "G" and explain what happened and show her the email copy indicating the mistake. She states that this particular document does not require "for _ only" and instructed me to come back and they will redo it for Free. Today, 9/20, I go in speak with Raquel, catch him up on my conversation with his wife. His reason for not redoing was because nationwide rep was not present in store with me and it would be illegal for him to do so. I request a refund for his document error. At first his stance was services were rendered because the dicument has been accepted in the past and its his principles (whatever they were). Finally we agree that he should issue a refund. He soon changed his mind and after I suggested him and his wife get on one accord with the policy and look into new notary standards. Razuel ordered me to leave because I should just be quiet (his words). I obviously refused and called the police instead.
A refund was eventually issued after the police arrived, however not before Razuel allowed his pride to dictate his moral code.

Customers are in the business of donating funds to your business. Yes, you should be accountable for rendering services properly.

name: nancy newman

text: We sent one of our employees to pick up a cargo Van, there was a delay in out Florida U-Haul when making transactions for the other drivers in Florida, so it stopped the rental in AL at this location temporarily, nevertheless, the general general manager at this location told our employee to not waste her TIME WITH US......she wrongfully advised our employee to dismiss us, I have never had this experience with U-Haul. It took 20 minutes to resolve but she still had given that advise. Ridiculous!

name: Anthony Bunger
text:
Tl;dr I moved from Glen Iris to Hueytown in a few hours and paid $150 for a 15’ truck.Conflicting information from representatives, stressful environment, overpriced. Moving is already stressful, and having to deal with people who want to make things harder is a no-go. I don’t plan on using uhaul again after my experience at this location.

Rented a truck from here on Saturday morning that was due back Sunday at a different location in ensley.

The woman working Saturday morning was helpful, and suggested returning the truck back at the same location because it might be cheaper for us, depending on the mileage and our specific situation.

We were done with the truck early, brought it back that night around 5 to a different uhaul rep (a man). While he was helping us, a different woman uhaul rep told us that we couldn’t return our truck to a different location than on our sheet because it would be more expensive, while the man smirked. Obviously I was confused. I was unable to contact the location that I was supposed to return the truck to (in ensley). When i told her the woman from the morning told us it would be cheaper and insisted she said “okay, charge him! Charge him!” I waited for a long time for her to direct the man in how to check my truck in, And eventually she went out to the vehicle and came back to show me $1,075 charge that would be applied If I returned the vehicle here. So After an hour and a half of run-around, intimidation, and waiting, I left to the place in ensley and returned my truck there, where no one was working (it was 6:20 pm) and left the keys in a box.

name: Lilly Putar
text: Whatever you do, do not hire top of the line moving and labor services to help you move. They do their business/evil through U-Haul and will damage your stuff when they move it. They will then follow that up by coming back to your property to destroy stuff. In my case, they broke into my car. Uhaul trucks are also terrible and mine overheated and killed my cat. I think its fair to say I hate U Haul.

name: Gampy

Using her authority for ways to get over on customers I will never use this company again ! Also durning the return she hops in a Tahoe and pulls off with no information still .

I'm sorry you had a bad experience at our store.  We do our best to make every customer's experience a good one.   I can assure you there is no problem with you speaking Spanish. text: This place just tried to charge me $5 to run off 1 black and white piece of paper. My biggest mistake was coming period. This is exactly why UPS continues to be a joke!

resp.text:
Mr. Burchfield:  I'm sorry your experience did not meet your expectations.  When you were in and said you wanted to email us a document to print, I asked how many pages (1) and if it was black and white (yes).  I offered you a $2 alternative to the email, which was to log on to our wi-fi, and print the document to our wi-fi printer instead of the $5 email charge.

Sincerley,
Mark Berthiaume
Manager

I paid for overnight service for something that was never sent and I had to open and investigation for my package. I’m disappointed in my first and last experience with UPS. I’ll stick to FEDEX.

resp.text:
I don't show a shipment from our UPS Store with the name of Brielle Deloris.  Could you supply me with the tracking number so I can research the shipment in question.  There is one NDA shipment sent recently that a customer came into our store to ask some questions about.  I'm not sure if that is the shipment you are referencing or not, but I would be glad to have a dialogue with you regarding your shipment.
Sincerely,
Mark Berthiaume - Manager

text: I received a package ordered from Amazon that was open and only 1 item in it when I had ordered 2. It was Closys mouthwash. The UPS store was not responsible for this.  They’re store is only for drop offs.  They are very kind and helpful.

text: Keith Sides and his employees are fantastic. I use them for all of my mailing needs, fingerprinting, and greeting card purchases. I'm always greeted by a smiling face, and the services is worth more than five stars.

text: Had the pleasure of spending almost one hpur speaking with Keith, the Owner of this UPS Store tonight. I arrived as the clock struck 6:30 pm (Closing Time) to pick up some print media for our Bakery, as someone outsourced our Order and I had no idea what to expect re: the finished product. Mr. Sides was laid back, personable and our product looks fantastic. He not only won my business moving forward but I will be using Keith and this (specific) UPS Store (although it is a good 20-25 minutes outside of the way) in the future for custom orders relative to our Brand. A+

text: I had a commissioned painting I needed shipped to my sister in NC.  The crew at Caldwell Mill UPS Store took great care in packaging the painting and it arrived in tact and exactly on time.  The little extra it may cost to ship ANYTHING via UPS vs. the US Postal system is totally worth it.  Highly recommend this store!!

name: Cameron McKinley
text: This is my favorite UPS Store and I will drive out of my way to go here because of the great customer service. Zared, the front counter manager, is amazing. She is efficient, friendly, knowledgeable, and a problem-solver. I am always in and out quickly and everything ships as planned. Thank you for your commitment to the community!

resp.text: Cameron....thank you very much for your kind review and for being a loyal customer.  We try to make sure every customer feels unique and that we always provide excellent service.  Zared, and the rest of her team at the front counter, work hard and do an awesome job!  Keith

text:
Love Keith and everyone at this UPS Location. There is no better place to go.
We use them to ship and print for our business as well as personal use.

name: RRozsa
text: I love this place.  They are friendly, helpful, and efficient!  Mailing a package is never a hassle, and ithe store is in a very convenient location -- easy to get in and out of quickly.

name: Andy Entrekin
text: Friendly and knowledgeable staff. They took care of me!

name: Leslie Cremer
text: The best place to go for shipping needs!  The people here are always nice and willing to help. If I ever got to the point where I lived farther away I would drive all that way to get there.

resp.text: Leslie...I apologize for the late response but we certainly appreciate your vote of confidence.  Our counter staff works hard to provide excellent service each and every day.  Please, if you ever do move further away, always come back to see us.  Keith

name: Ella Fulcher
text: I had some plates that got shattered during shipment and a package that got labeled wrong.  I called the store and spoke with Zared who looked into my shipment and helped me return the wrong package and is working on getting me refunded for the plates.  Zared has been super helpful and sweet as we work through getting things processed and together.

resp.text: Ella....Thank you for your kind words about the service provided by Zared.  She and all our staff have the goal of providing the best in customer service.  While accidents do happen, we are always ready and willing to do whatever it takes to make it right.

name: Glenn Mazer
text: I could not submit another review so I'm editing a previous one to respond to Gabriel's review left a few days ago because it is not indicative of the UPS Store, the staff, or it's owner. She writes, "What good is the UPS store if I can’t ship postal packages.. just one more inconvenience because people can’t do their jobs right!!!" This review needs to be directed to the USPS, not the UPS store, she named the wrong entity in her review. She is correct about people not doing their job because that's the very reason the UPS store stopped taking prepaid USPS packages, because the USPS can't do their job. They lose packages, packages are delayed because they can't do their job and the UPS store should not have to take the blame for the USPS inadequate culture. So guess what? They don't have to take any more of the blame because they can't provide an accommodation for a service that is so inept in which they get blamed for. I am in this store just about everyday to get my mail. Regardless of how busy the staff is, I’m always treated with, “hello Mr. Mazer.” Zared and her crew are the most dedicated, service oriented people I’ve ever encountered. They get bombarded with shipping and packaging around this time of year, but they don’t change their demeanor. Keith, the owner, is a great guy and it’s no wonder why he has great people working for him. It is because he knows how to treat people and how people want to be treated. For that person that upgraded her one star to three stars, shame on you for blaming these fine folks for your ignorance.

resp.text: Glenn....always a pleasure to see you and thank you for your kind words.  I am blessed with good people whose goal is always to help our customers whether it be shipping, printing or any other of our business services.  If ever we fail to live up to your expectations - let me know - we'll make it right!  Keith

name: Jennifer Henshaw
text: Devon is an amazing employee! She stayed late to help me out and is very quick with her job! I think that's how she spelled her name but didn't get a good look. 10/10 for her!

resp.text: Jennifer....Thank you for your kind comments regarding Devyn.  She, and all our staff, hope to provide the best in customer service.  We are here to be of help any time we can.

name: Bryan Kirkland
text: Victoria was very helpful and patient with my products that had to be shipped. It's not everyday a racing wheelchair with two sets of wheels are shipped but she handled it like a pro and beyond pleasant to talk to. She listened to what I explained to her about how to package the carbon fiber wheels so that they wouldn't  get damaged from the axel's touching one another. I was dreading the process but came out of it with a smile on my face.

name: Mary Waldman
text:
I was charged a $20 rush fee for a small photocopy print job I submitted the day before. When I questioned the charge, I was told that same day photocopying was considered a rush. I pointed out that I had submitted the job the day before - I'd called the shop to make sure the email had come through and the clerk said the copy shop had left early. The best the manager could do was a 15% discount on the rush fee. I asked where this policy was noted and the staff had to dig out a notebook page buried on a back counter (that didn't list the policy). I just checked the website and there's no mention of rush charges, or even print prices.
(Update: this review started as a 1-star but I have changed it to a 3-star based on the managers quick response and offer to ameliorate the situation.)

resp.text:
Good morning....thank you for your comments and I want to start off by apologizing for the confusion on the rush fee.  We had understood the items were needed by 4:30pm that day and, as such, a rush fee would normally apply for same day jobs handled by our print department.  My apologies that you did not receive a quote before we proceeded on the job which would have outlined all charges and requested your approval to proceed.

Because of our error and because we value each customer’s business and their satisfaction with our work, I want to offer a cash refund to you for the rush fee or a print credit to be used on a future job.  We hope to see you again and trust you will find our service level improved.

Keith Sides

name: Jamie White
text: Keith at the UPS store on Caldwell Mill Road does a terrific job! His employees are always friendly and fast. I would recommend you use THIS UPS store for all of your printing needs.

name: Daniel Gallegly
text:
Keith grew a beard. I thought he was in the witness protection program when I ran into him. But he looks sharp and distinguished with the new look.

He has a great local print and ship shop that always did a good job for us and their people behind the counter have great attitudes and are really helpful and nice.

Good turn around and design quality always looks good. Keith runs a tight ship even with a beard.

name: Johnny Carcioppolo
text: This is the place to go for your printing needs!!! Colby and Donna did an amazing job for me in a pinch. The price was right and the service was outstanding. We even had one small issue and without a second thought they took care of everything in record time. If you have printing needs and you want reliable, cost efficient, professional and friendly service this is where you need to go. I will certainly have them do much more of my printing now.

name: A Robin
text: The sign on the door says "We're open".  They closed early today at noon.  They are closed.  The Inverness location is still open and has regular business hours.

resp.text: Hi...I'm sorry we missed you.  As the virus epidemic unfolded we were attempting to adjust hours for the safety of our employees and convenience of our customers.  I'm glad our Inverness store was able to assist you.

name: Daniel Gallegly
text:
These people do a GREAT JOB. The owner, Keith, and his team are very professional, and I was pleasantly surprised at the many different services that they offer. This store also has a printing department, which has done a great job printing all of our materials. The quality of the graphic design is also very strong.

I highly recommend the UPS Store on Caldwell Mill Road!!

name: Christy McDonald
text: Colby Green at the UPS STORE on Caldwell Mill RD truly is awesome!  He makes everything so easy.  The quality and price is definitely better than anywhere I've checked.  I've used them for business cards, post card mailers, stationary, stickers and etc.  Give them a shot, you won't regret it!

name: Tessie Barrett
text: Colby and the guys at UPS are awesome! They have made name tags, yard signs, business cards (in an hours notice.... ). Truly amazing. I highly recommend them to anyone.  Also ask about their flyer mail outs! Good stuff.

text: Have printing, shipping, labeling, storage needs? Colby Green and all of the folks at Store 2389 are the best in the business! They can take care of your needs, and are great when it comes to answering all your questions. They really do a fantastic job. Could not recommend anyone in their line of work more highly!

name: Brice Jackson
text: I use Caldwell Mill UPS Store for my Print! They always do an excellent job in a timely manner! Staff is knowledgeable & helpful. They respond quickly to email and a delight to work with.

name: Woodie Westbrook
text: Great service, helpful staff.  The manager seemed very knowledgeable and was willing to work with me to help with a lot of last minute printing.  I couldn't recommend them a enough.  Any time I am in Birmingham this is where I will go.

name: Down In Front Productions LLC
text: The BEST printers in the area. They have helped us with numerous projects on a tight timeline and have more than satisfied us every single time! We highly recommend them!

text: Terrible customer service.   Store manager was very rude & condescending to myself & other customers in the store at the time. I was just printing out some papers, was never even acknowledged or offered help. When I did ask for help was treated rudely almost as if I was an annoyance. Will never set foot in this store again.

name: James Burton
text: I've never had to wait here. Great place.

name: Blake Hargrove
text: Friendly staff that took care of me right away.

name: Jeff Peterson
text:
If you're looking for honest service and a helpful staff - GO ELSEWHERE.

After a relative passed away, I packaged and shipped five boxes to our home across the country.  We told the employee that we wanted the most economical option - the contents were valuable and needed insurance (china, books, birdhouse, rug, etc.), but speed was not a concern.  We were told 3 day residential was the cheapest option.

One of the five boxes was completely crushed during shipment and several china pieces were broken despite purchasing nearly $100 of bubble wrap and china specific packaging supplies.  I filed a claim with UPS, provided pictures, etc.  Without inspecting the box, UPS ultimately denied the claim because there was a sweater in the package that I'd sent in the box to free up room for stuff in my luggage.  UPS claimed it was inappropriate packaging material even though it was just part of the contents.  UPS would not discuss the denial with me because UPS deemed the UPS Store as the shipper (not me).

During the claims process, I found out that ground service was available and would have been ~$200 less expensive.

I called the UPS store and spoke to the manager.  I started by telling her about the insurance denial.  She said it was not their issue since they didn't package the box.  I agreed, but told her UPS will only speak with them (as the shipper) and that they needed to act on my behalf to help resolve the issue.  I next mentioned that we could have shipped the boxes via ground for less money and that staff misled us.  She became INCREDIBLY RUDE and told me the staff just recommended that service - not that it wasn't the cheapest option.  I pushed back and asked if she was present at the time of the transaction - she said no.  With no knowledge of the interaction, she continued to blindly and aggressively tell me what her staff said and did.  It was clear the conversation was going nowhere.

A manager from a different location called later.  She said they'd file an appeal with UPS on our behalf.  No followup occurred.

I rarely get fired up, but this experience was AWFUL!  The staff misled and overcharged us.  UPS denied a claim without ever inspecting the box.  UPS would not speak to me despite my family boxing, shipping, paying for and receiving the boxes.  The manager was incredibly rude.  They were unhelpful and failed to help resolve the claim with UPS.

This is a great store if this is the service you're looking for.

To make it even worse, as I was filing the dispute with UPS (which took hours and multiple calls), I contacted the UPS Store to get copies of our receipt.  They were helpful and said they'd send over the receipts.  Instead of sending our receipt, they accidentally emailed me a copy of another customer's DRIVERS LICENSE and SOCIAL SECURITY CARD.  I guess you can add careless to the list too.....

FIND ANOTHER WAY/LOCATION TO SHIP YOUR UPS PACKAGES!

name: Ben Brady
text: rude Cheryl going to fedex

resp.text: Hi, and thank you for visiting our store. We apologize if you had a bad experience in our store. We invite you back to further discuss what happened and to see what actions need to be taken. Maybe there was just a misunderstanding. Please contact us at your earliest convenience.

name: Don Hembree
text: Worst UPS service center experience I’ve ever had. Went in for a simple drop off of a Verizon phone return using the Verizon provided box and shipping label and the owner/attendant  require that I buy a new box from him before shipping. Took to another UPS location and dropped off with no problem.  This is obviously a scam

resp.text: We apologize about your experience in our store. We do invite you back in to better address the situation. Policy states that USPS packaging are for USPS shipping only depending on their service, UPS Express packaging is for UPS Express Services only, and FedEx packaging is for FedEx services only. Thank you!

name: Nicole Smith
text: Went in to this location today at 5:30pm because I needed to give my fingerprints for some documents, when I went in a blonde haired lady with her hair pulled in a high bun who wore glasses  asked what I needed and I told her I needed to give my fingerprints, she then proceeded to tell me they quit doing prints at 5 which is not a big deal I would have came back tomorrow, I was curious as to why they quit taking fingerprints at 5 so I asked the lady, she then said “because we do!” I thought I misinterpreted what she said so I said “I’m sorry did you say because we do” her reply was yup. I asked the lady to speak to a manager she said there wasn’t one there so I asked her name and she stated Cheryl. I was in such shock that she was that rude, I will be contacting management or higher up in the morning! That is just no way to treat customers and is highly upsetting that someone who works with the public doesn’t know how to deal with the public. Terrible customer service!!!!!

resp.text: We do apologize for the way our employee has treated you on your last visit. The real reason we stop doing fingerprints after 5pm is because we try to have two or more employees on the floor, one to assist our fingerprint customers when they come in and one to handle other customers with their needs. We do invite you to come back in to talk with us about redeeming this experience. Thank you!

text:
The African American manager was very rude and unfriendly to his employees and to the customers!

I return packages all the time to Amazon and I never pay a dime.

This representative made me pay $12 for PACKAGING!!!

resp.text:
I would first like to apologize if I came off abrasive or seemed short with anyone. That was not my intention. There were several factors at play and maybe my directness was not well received.
Unfortunately, your Amazon return was not covered for The UPS Store to pack and ship. Yes, Amazon covered your shipping, but they did not cover your packaging. Not all Amazon returns are free returns. Not all Amazon returns are covered for The UPS Store to pack and ship. A shipping label only covers shipping costs. It does not cover packaging. Also, I did not make you pay for packaging. I said if you wish for us to package your return, then it was going to be $12. I do invite you back to our location for a more personal apology and to possibly review this incident to come to a better understanding.

Any package that goes to the Eastaboga, AL office is likely to be lost forever. I placed an order with a well known retailer 3 weeks ago and the driver left it at a house in different zip code. The retailer sent it a second time and I just got a notice that the delivery failed because no one was at home. text: Place is as scammy as they come! One of our packages has been delivered to wrong address and one of our neighbors brought it over. Here’s reason why I’m inclined to believe that our second package was stolen - we forced them to deliver correctly was when we included a request to have package released under signature upon delivery. So driver knows where our place is and where to deliver... Now every time we order anything shipped, we specifically request NOT to ship items with FedEx...

name: TJ Redrock
text: I can see why all the negative reviews. I had package scheduled to be delivered to our office and everything was on time until I got a delivery exception notification. It claimed that our business was close, which was not the case. We are under construction, but have very, very clear signs on directing traffic. Giving the benefit of the doubt, I called Fedex to let them know I need that pack THE DAY IT WAS SCHEDULED and that THEIR DRIVER is the one that failed to read clearly marked signs on where to deliver it. Neither UPS or USPS and any issues delivering. They sent the local hub the message that we needed the package that day. I scheduled this 15 mins after I got the delivery exception. The driver couldn't have been very far away at this time. After 5 o'clock I called again and basically said that they were not delivering it and that I could not pick it up until the next day. If I needed it the next day, that's when I would have scheduled the delivery. FedEx basically told me they don't care that it was their fault my package wasn't in my hand and they weren't going to do anything about it. Talk about great customer service. If you can, stick with UPS or even USPS if you want your package on time.

Horrible place!

name: Billy Voluntarist Burger
text: Next day delivery. Yeah right! Got jacked around. My account has had specific instructions to leave all packages on front porch if no one is home. Called customer service several times. I got several different stories from several different people as to why package was not left. I was told I could drive 50 miles to pickup at the ship center on Saturday or wait until Monday for re-delivery. Then I was told that the shipper could request Saturday delivery. I conference the the shipper and Fed-ex and shipper provided account number for Saturday delivery. After being on the phone and talking to 4-5 diffrent people over a 2 hour period, I finally was told by a supervisor that the fed-ex ship center where my package was being held, was not even open on Saturday.REALLY? So due to thier incompetence not only will I not get my "next day package" on time, but when I do finally get the shipment, it will be useless to me. I guess I'm lucky I called back enough times to finally figure out that the ship-center was not open Saturdays, before I made a 100 mile round trip for nothing. Do not use Fed-ex if you need to get your packages delivered on-time. They cannot follow shipping instructions and are incompetent.

Tried to get in touch with someone from this facility to find out where the driver was, because I knew he had to be in my vicinity, only to be directed to some call center overseas where they didn't have any helpful information. If I could give zero stars, I would. Piss poor performance from this location.

wish I could give them a 0

text:
Several times on critical overnight or next day packages have not received them on time. Have received them as promised about half the time.  This FedEx location has terrible logistics. That is complicated by the fact that you cannot contact that place directly. So everytime I call I get someone in a central location who tells me that the bozo has "put it on the wrong van". So I had to cancel plans twice to stay in town to get the packages. Will not use FedEx again. Unfortunately the shipper use FedEx. They have not arrived at the same conclusion I have yet but they will with time

Update 3months later....ok so since then I've had 4 more packages shipped with Fed Sux. One an expensive cello...arrived as promised. The other 3 ...DAYS late! It's unbelievable!!! UPS is killing FedSux. I get daily deliveries from UPS and you can bet your first born it will be delivered on the day it's promised

We were surprised that the doors were lock because it was not 6pm. My husband knock on the door because the office inside light was on. I called the 800 number to see why the location closed early. The first customer service representative assistant that the location did not have a number. I hung up the phone and called again; the next customer rep was nice and she contact the location to see why the doors were closed before 6pm. Customer service rep stated that Jenny said that she was assisting another customer and she lock the door at 6pm. While i was on the phone with the customer rep the lady, Jenny, came to the door. She open the door half way and got my recipt and allowed me to come in the building. She stated to me that she lock the door at 6pm..i told her she didnt while still on the phone with fedx customer rep...the lady Jenny handed me back my reciept and told me I can get my package tommorrow. Customer service suck and that lady need to be fired.

text: Glad to have these guys so close.  Really convenient.

text: Fast friendly service going through the drive through during Covid-19.

name: Scott Fillmer
text:
They do what they are there to do, provide a solid reliable service to ship and they are very easy and convenient to drop off FedEx, UPS, or USPS. They don’t always have a ton of USPS supplies, which is ok but I’d do anything over having to go to the post office, and their prices are almost highway robbery. I get they have to mark up services, and for the most part shipping has become so expensive they are just passing along the cost, but it’s consistently very expensive to just take a box there to pay to ship if you are going UPS/FedEx. If so, get a prepaid label and drop it off, it’s just way too expensive. USPS prices are pretty standard so if sending Priority Mail just use a flat rate and ship from there.

Outside shipping they have a great mail box service that will allow you to get an address that isn’t a PO Box but functions just like one. Prices are reasonable and the service is fantastic. Owners of the Pak Mail in Auburn are very involved in the community and support the area.

name: Erin Martin

name: Lauren Vernon
text: I wish I could give 0 stars. Their delivery driver propped a 70 pound gun safe on my garage door. He/she did not knock to let us know where it was. When we opened the garage door it fell on my car!!! Now my car and the gun safe are damaged. To make matters even worse, they are currently ignoring my husband’s phone calls. Corporate said it was their responsibility to pay for the damages, but apparently the local office doesn’t seem to think so. Now I have another package to be delivered by them soon, and I am dreading it. I would purposely not order from any company that uses them if I could figure that information out.

text: I guess we're just leaving things on the side of the road now.

name: Kimberly Smith
text:
A pure nightmare! Ordered lawnmower on walmart.com with 2 day delivery. Ordered Fri morning and was given delivery date of Monday. Monday morning at 6:08am, the package was scanned at Birmingham facility and "Out for Delivery" by the end of the day on Monday. Waited for package all day. Approx 7pm, status went from "out for delivery" to "pending". Started
calling for updates beginning Tuesday morning and package just seem to have disappeared. Customer service is obviously in another country and they can't tell me anything. It's Thursday now and still no package OR delivery date. I've offered to go pick it up and was told I didn't have that option. So my $300 paid in full lawnmower is no where to be found and I'm told I "just need to be patient". Who are they to decide when they want to deliver??? I will never use FedEx again nor will I order from any company that uses this carrier.

name: L&S Taylor
text: If I could give it no stars I would. This is the worst place ever. Package suppose be delivered on Monday here it is Thursday and still no package and this was multiple gifts for a Christmas party tomorrow. Even paid for express shipping. Still haven’t received the packages and was lied to when I called them. They stated the company put it for standard delivery and I had the company we purchased for on the other end of the phone that stated no they did not. It was sent express delivery and Belk had sent me the proof. Fedex phone rep still continued to lie on Belk. Then when told we were recording the conversation and wanted to see proof that Belk had sent the shipment out for standard 5-7 day delivery as he told us and have it emailed for documentation purposes he hung up because he knew he was caught in his own web of lies. On top of that, it shows the package has been at the Birmingham facility since the 10th and yet still hasn’t been delivered. The second package shows it is in Georgia and has been for 2 days with no movement. The rep said nobody would answer the phones at the Georgia facility in Kennesaw as well as this Birmingham facility so he couldnt speak with them about why the packages hasn’t moved or been delivered. This place is a total joke and fraud. They charge you for express shipping and never do it. That is the same as stealing from people. They take your money and then do not deliver. Horrible!
